Marseilles.

  HELENA.
 Not here, sir?
  GENTLEMAN.

    He hence remov'd last night, and with more haste
    Than is his use.
 And you shall find yourself to be well thank'd,
    Whate'er falls more.
 We must to horse again;
    Go, go, provide.
 Good Monsieur Lavache, give my Lord Lafeu this letter.

  CLOWN.

  PAROLLES.
 Indeed, sir, if your metaphor stink, I will stop my nose; or
    against any man's metaphor.
 Prithee, get thee further.
 My lord, I am a man whom Fortune hath cruelly scratch'd.
 You beg more than word then.
    [Trumpets sound]  The King's coming; I
    know by his trumpets.
 Though you are a fool and a knave, you
    shall eat.
 The COUNT'S palace

Flourish.

  KING.

  LAFEU.
 Praising what is lost
    Makes the remembrance dear.
 What says he to your daughter? Have you spoke?
  LAFEU.
  

                          Enter BERTRAM

  LAFEU.

  BERTRAM.
 You remember
    The daughter of this lord?
  BERTRAM.
 Which better than the first, O dear heaven, bless!
    Or, ere they meet, in me, O nature, cesse!
  LAFEU.
 My gracious sovereign,
    Howe'er it pleases you to take it so,
    The ring was never hers.
 Son, on my life,
    I have seen her wear it; and she reckon'd it
    At her life's rate.
 She never saw it.
 Thou speak'st it falsely, as I love mine honour;
    And mak'st conjectural fears to come into me
    Which I would fain shut out.
 Gracious sovereign,
    Whether I have been to blame or no, I know not:
    Here's a petition from a Florentine,  
    Who hath, for four or five removes, come short
    To tender it herself.
 He stole from Florence, taking no leave,
    and I follow him to his country for justice.
'
  LAFEU.

                                               Exeunt ATTENDANTS
    I am afeard the life of Helen, lady,
    Was foully snatch'd.

    And that you fly them as you swear them lordship,
    Yet you desire to marry.

  WIDOW.
 I am her mother, sir, whose age and honour
    Both suffer under this complaint we bring,
    And both shall cease, without your remedy.
  
  KING.

  LAFEU.
 Good my lord,
    Ask him upon his oath if he does think
    He had not my virginity.
 She's impudent, my lord,
    And was a common gamester to the camp.
 o, behold this ring,
    Whose high respect and rich validity
    Did lack a parallel; yet, for all that,
    He gave it to a commoner o' th' camp,
    If I be one.
 This is his wife:
    That ring's a thousand proofs.

  DIANA.
 She got the ring;  
    And I had that which any inferior might
    At market-price have bought.
 I pray you yet-
    Since you lack virtue, I will lose a husband-
    Send for your ring, I will return it home,
    And give me mine again.

  KING.
 The story, then, goes false you threw it him
    Out of a casement.
 My lord, I do confess the ring was hers.
 You boggle shrewdly; every feather starts you.

  KING.
 How, I pray you?
  PAROLLES.
 As thou art a knave and no knave.
 Ay, my good lord.
 It was not lent me neither.
 It might be yours or hers, for aught I know.
 By Jove, if ever I knew man, 'twas you.
 Because he's guilty, and he is not guilty.
 She does abuse our ears; to prison with her.

    Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick;
    So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick-
    And now behold the meaning.

  BERTRAM.
 Both, both; o, pardon!
  HELENA.
 O, my good lord, when I was like this maid,
    I found you wondrous kind.
 This it says:
    'When from my finger you can get this ring,
    And are by me with child,' etc.
       [Flourish]

EPILOGUE
                             EPILOGUE.


  KING.
 AEMILIUS LEPIDUS,     "
  SEXTUS POMPEIUS,         "
  DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, friend to Antony
  VENTIDIUS,             "    "   "
  EROS,                  "    "   "
  SCARUS,                "    "   "
  DERCETAS,              "    "   "
  DEMETRIUS,             "    "   "
  PHILO,                 "    "   "
  MAECENAS,   friend to Caesar
  AGRIPPA,       "    "   "
  DOLABELLA,     "    "   "
  PROCULEIUS,    "    "   "
  THYREUS,       "    "   "
  GALLUS,        "    "   "
  MENAS,      friend to Pompey
  MENECRATES,    "    "    "
  VARRIUS,       "    "    "  
  TAURUS, Lieutenant-General to Caesar
  CANIDIUS, Lieutenant-General to Antony
  SILIUS, an Officer in Ventidius's army
  EUPHRONIUS, an Ambassador from Antony to Caesar
  ALEXAS,   attendant on Cleopatra
  MARDIAN,      "     "      "
  SELEUCUS,     "     "      "
  DIOMEDES,     "     "      "
  A SOOTHSAYER
  A CLOWN

  CLEOPATRA, Queen of Egypt
  OCTAVIA, sister to Caesar and wife to Antony
  CHARMIAN, lady attending on Cleopatra
  IRAS,       "      "      "     "



  Officers, Soldiers, Messengers, and Attendants



<<THIS ELECTRONIC VERSION OF THE COMPLETE WORKS OF WILLIAM
SHAKESPEARE IS COPYRIGHT 1990-1993 BY WORLD LIBRARY, INC.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.
 Grates me the sum.
 Perchance? Nay, and most like,
    You must not stay here longer; your dismission
    Is come from Caesar; therefore hear it, Antony.
  
    Where's Fulvia's process? Caesar's I would say? Both?
    Call in the messengers.
 Antony
    Will be himself.

  ANTONY.

  DEMETRIUS.
 Your will?
  CHARMIAN.
 Bring in the banquet quickly; wine enough
    Cleopatra's health to drink.
 Good, sir, give me good fortune.

  CHARMIAN.

  CHARMIAN.

  CHARMIAN.

  CHARMIAN.
 Find me to
    marry me with Octavius Caesar, and companion me with my mistress.

  CHARMIAN.
 Out, fool! I forgive thee for a witch.
 You think none but your sheets are privy to your wishes.

  ALEXAS.

  IRAS.
 Go, you wild bedfellow, you cannot soothsay.
 Nay, if an oily palm be not a fruitful prognostication, I
    cannot scratch mine ear.

  SOOTHSAYER.
 Amen.
 Lo now, if it lay in their hands to make me a cuckold, they
    would make themselves whores but they'ld do't!

                          Enter CLEOPATRA

  ENOBARBUS.
 Hush! Here comes Antony.
 Not he; the Queen.
 Was he not here?
  CHARMIAN.
 Here, at your service.
 My lord approaches.


          Enter ANTONY, with a MESSENGER and attendants

  CLEOPATRA.
 Against my brother Lucius?
  MESSENGER.

    But soon that war had end, and the time's state
    Made friends of them, jointing their force 'gainst Caesar,
    Whose better issue in the war from Italy
    Upon the first encounter drave them.
 The nature of bad news infects the teller.

  ANTONY.
 Labienus-
    This is stiff news- hath with his Parthian force
    Extended Asia from Euphrates,
    His conquering banner shook from Syria
    To Lydia and to Ionia,
    Whilst-
  ANTONY.
 At your noble pleasure.


                 Enter another MESSENGER with a letter

    What are you?
  SECOND MESSENGER.

    Her length of sickness, with what else more serious
    Importeth thee to know, this bears.
 Forbear me.
 Under a compelling occasion, let women die.
 She is cunning past man's thought.

  ANTONY.
 Would I had never seen her!
  ENOBARBUS.
 Fulvia is dead.

  ENOBARBUS.
 For not alone
    The death of Fulvia, with more urgent touches,
    Do strongly speak to us; but the letters to
    Of many our contriving friends in Rome
    Petition us at home.
 Sextus Pompeius
    Hath given the dare to Caesar, and commands  
    The empire of the sea; our slippery people,
    Whose love is never link'd to the deserver
    Till his deserts are past, begin to throw
    Pompey the Great and all his dignities
    Upon his son; who, high in name and power,
    Higher than both in blood and life, stands up
    For the main soldier; whose quality, going on,
    The sides o' th' world may danger.
 Quick, and return.
        Exit ALEXAS
  CHARMIAN.
 What should I do I do not?
  CHARMIAN.
 In each thing give him way; cross him in nothing.
 Thou teachest like a fool- the way to lose him.

    What says the married woman? You may go.

  ANTONY.
 The gods best know-
  CLEOPATRA.
 O, never was there queen
    So mightily betray'd! Yet at the first
    I saw the treasons planted.
 Nay, pray you seek no colour for your going,
    But bid farewell, and go.

  ANTONY.
 The condemn'd Pompey,
    Rich in his father's honour, creeps apace
    Into the hearts of such as have not thrived
    Upon the present state, whose numbers threaten;
    And quietness, grown sick of rest, would purge
    By any desperate change.

  CLEOPATRA.
 She's dead, my Queen.

    Look here, and at thy sovereign leisure read
    The garboils she awak'd.
 By the fire
    That quickens Nilus' slime, I go from hence
    Thy soldier, servant, making peace or war
    As thou affects.

  ANTONY.
 My precious queen, forbear,
    And give true evidence to his love, which stands
    An honourable trial.
 You can do better yet; but this is meetly.
 Still he mends;
    But this is not the best.

  CLEOPATRA.
 But that your royalty
    Holds idleness your subject, I should take you
    For idleness itself.
 Come.
 CAESAR'S house

Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, reading a letter; LEPIDUS, and their train

  CAESAR.
 You may see, Lepidus, and henceforth know,
    It is not Caesar's natural vice to hate
    Our great competitor.
 From Alexandria
    This is the news: he fishes, drinks, and wastes
    The lamps of night in revel; is not more manlike
    Than Cleopatra, nor the queen of Ptolemy
    More womanly than he; hardly gave audience, or
    Vouchsaf'd to think he had partners.
 I must not think there are
    Evils enow to darken all his goodness.
 Say this becomes him-
    As his composure must be rare indeed
    Whom these things cannot blemish- yet must Antony
    No way excuse his foils when we do bear
    So great weight in his lightness.
 Pompey is strong at sea,
    And it appears he is belov'd of those
    That only have fear'd Caesar.
 To the ports
    The discontents repair, and men's reports
    Give him much wrong'd.

  MESSENGER.
 Caesar, I bring thee word
    Menecrates and Menas, famous pirates,
    Make the sea serve them, which they ear and wound  
    With keels of every kind.
 Pompey
    Thrives in our idleness.

  CAESAR.
 CLEOPATRA'S palace

Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and MARDIAN

  CLEOPATRA.
 Charmian!
  CHARMIAN.

  CHARMIAN.
 Why, madam?
  CLEOPATRA.
 What's your Highness' pleasure?
  CLEOPATRA.

    Yet have I fierce affections, and think
    What Venus did with Mars.
 Now I feed myself
    With most delicious poison.
 Think on me,
    That am with Phoebus' amorous pinches black,
    And wrinkled deep in time? Broad-fronted Caesar,
    When thou wast here above the ground, I was
    A morsel for a monarch; and great Pompey
    Would stand and make his eyes grow in my brow;  
    There would he anchor his aspect and die
    With looking on his life.

    How goes it with my brave Mark Antony?
  ALEXAS.

  CLEOPATRA.
 Mine ear must pluck it thence.
 O well-divided disposition! Note him,
    Note him, good Charmian; 'tis the man; but note him!
    He was not sad, for he would shine on those
    That make their looks by his; he was not merry,
    Which seem'd to tell them his remembrance lay
    In Egypt with his joy; but between both.

    O heavenly mingle! Be'st thou sad or merry,
    The violence of either thee becomes,
    So does it no man else.
 Be chok'd with such another emphasis!
    Say 'the brave Antony.
 By Isis, I will give thee bloody teeth
    If thou with Caesar paragon again
    My man of men.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.
 Know, worthy Pompey,
    That what they do delay they not deny.
 Caesar gets money where  
    He loses hearts.
 Where have you this? 'Tis false.

  MENAS.

    His wife that's dead did trespasses to Caesar;
    His brother warr'd upon him; although, I think,
    Not mov'd by Antony.

    Come, Menas.
                                          Exeunt




SCENE II.
 Good Enobarbus, 'tis a worthy deed,
    And shall become you well, to entreat your captain
    To soft and gentle speech.

  LEPIDUS.

  ENOBARBUS.
 I do not know, Maecenas.
 Ask Agrippa.
 Welcome to Rome.

  ANTONY.
 Sit, sir.
 I learn you take things ill which are not so,
    Or being, concern you not.
 You may be pleas'd to catch at mine intent
    By what did here befall me.
 If you'll patch a quarrel,
    As matter whole you have not to make it with,
    It must not be with this.
 As for my wife,
    I would you had her spirit in such another!
    The third o' th' world is yours, which with a snaffle
    You may pace easy, but not such a wife.

  CAESAR.
 I wrote to you
    When rioting in Alexandria; you
    Did pocket up my letters, and with taunts
    Did gibe my missive out of audience.

  CAESAR.

  LEPIDUS.
 If it might please you to enforce no further
    The griefs between ye- to forget them quite
    Were to remember that the present need
    Speaks to atone you.

  ENOBARBUS.
  
  ENOBARBUS.
 That truth should be silent I had almost forgot.

  ENOBARBUS.
 I am not married, Caesar.
 By this marriage
    All little jealousies, which now seem great,
    And all great fears, which now import their dangers,
    Would then be nothing.
 I did not think to draw my sword 'gainst Pompey;
    For he hath laid strange courtesies and great
    Of late upon me.
 I must thank him only,
    Lest my remembrance suffer ill report;
    At heel of that, defy him.

    Would we had spoke together! Haste we for it.
 Good Enobarbus!
  MAECENAS.
 Ay, sir; we did sleep day out of countenance and made
    the night light with drinking.
 Is this true?
  ENOBARBUS.
 This was but as a fly by an eagle.

  MAECENAS.

  ENOBARBUS.
 The city cast
    Her people out upon her; and Antony,
    Enthron'd i' th' market-place, did sit alone,
    Whistling to th' air; which, but for vacancy,
    Had gone to gaze on Cleopatra too,
    And made a gap in nature.
 Our courteous Antony,
    Whom ne'er the word of 'No' woman heard speak,
    Being barber'd ten times o'er, goes to the feast,
    And for his ordinary pays his heart
    For what his eyes eat only.

  ENOBARBUS.
 CAESAR'S house

Enter ANTONY, CAESAR, OCTAVIA between them

  ANTONY.
 All which time
    Before the gods my knee shall bow my prayers
    To them for you.

    I have not kept my square; but that to come
    Shall all be done by th' rule.
 Good night, dear lady.
 Good night, sir.
                  Exeunt CAESAR and OCTAVIA

                        Enter SOOTHSAYER

  ANTONY.

    Thy daemon, that thy spirit which keeps thee, is
    Noble, courageous, high, unmatchable,
    Where Caesar's is not; but near him thy angel
    Becomes a fear, as being o'erpow'r'd.
 Speak this no more.
 To none but thee; no more but when to thee.

    If thou dost play with him at any game,
    Thou art sure to lose; and of that natural luck
    He beats thee 'gainst the odds.
 If we draw lots, he speeds;
    His cocks do win the battle still of mine,
    When it is all to nought, and his quails ever
    Beat mine, inhoop'd, at odds.


                       Enter VENTIDIUS

    O, come, Ventidius,
    You must to Parthia.

Rome.

  AGRIPPA.

  LEPIDUS.

  MAECENAS.
 CLEOPATRA'S palace

Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS

  CLEOPATRA.
 Antony's dead! If thou say so, villain,  
    Thou kill'st thy mistress; but well and free,
    If thou so yield him, there is gold, and here
    My bluest veins to kiss- a hand that kings
    Have lipp'd, and trembled kissing.

  MESSENGER.

    But, sirrah, mark, we use
    To say the dead are well.
 If Antony
    Be free and healthful- why so tart a favour
    To trumpet such good tidings? If not well,
    Thou shouldst come like a Fury crown'd with snakes,
    Not like a formal man.

  CLEOPATRA.
' It does allay
    The good precedence; fie upon 'but yet'!
    'But yet' is as a gaoler to bring forth
    Some monstrous malefactor.

  MESSENGER.
 For what good turn?  
  MESSENGER.
 For the best turn i' th' bed.
 Madam, he's married to Octavia.
 Say 'tis not so, a province I will give thee,
    And make thy fortunes proud.

  MESSENGER.

    What mean you, madam? I have made no fault.
 Good madam, keep yourself within yourself:
    The man is innocent.
 Is he married?
    I cannot hate thee worser than I do
    If thou again say 'Yes.
'
  MESSENGER.
 He's married, madam.

  CLEOPATRA.
 The gods confound thee! Dost thou hold there still?
  MESSENGER.
 O, I would thou didst,
    So half my Egypt were submerg'd and made
    A cistern for scal'd snakes! Go, get thee hence.
 He is married?
  MESSENGER.
 He is married?
  MESSENGER.
 He's married to Octavia.
 O, that his fault should make a knave of thee  
    That art not what th'art sure of! Get thee hence.
 In praising Antony I have disprais'd Caesar.

Near Misenum

Flourish.
 Most meet
    That first we come to words; and therefore have we
    Our written purposes before us sent;
    Which if thou hast considered, let us know
    If 'twill tie up thy discontented sword
    And carry back to Sicily much tall youth
    That else must perish here.

  CAESAR.
 And what may follow,
    To try a larger fortune.

  ANTONY.
 I have heard it, Pompey,
    And am well studied for a liberal thanks
    Which I do owe you.

  POMPEY.
 Let me have your hand.
 The beds i' th' East are soft; and thanks to you,
    That call'd me timelier than my purpose hither;
    For I have gained by't.

  POMPEY.
 I hope so, Lepidus.
 We'll feast each other ere we part, and let's
    Draw lots who shall begin.

  ANTONY.
 No, Antony, take the lot;
    But, first or last, your fine Egyptian cookery
    Shall have the fame.

  POMPEY.

  MENAS.
 Y'have said, sir.
 True, sir; she was the wife of Caius Marcellus.
 But you shall find the band that seems
    to tie their friendship together will be the very strangler of
    their amity: Octavia is of a holy, cold, and still conversation.

  MENAS.
 He
    will to his Egyptian dish again; then shall the sighs of Octavia
    blow the fire up in Caesar, and, as I said before, that which is
    the strength of their amity shall prove the immediate author of
    their variance.
 Antony will use his affection where it is; he
    married but his occasion here.
 I shall take it, sir.
 Come, let's away.
 Here they'll be, man.
 [To CAESAR] Thus do they, sir: they take the flow o' th'
      Nile
    By certain scales i' th' pyramid; they know
    By th' height, the lowness, or the mean, if dearth
    Or foison follow.

  POMPEY.
 Sit- and some wine! A health to Lepidus!
  LEPIDUS.
 Without contradiction I have heard that.

  MENAS.
 What manner o' thing is your crocodile?
  ANTONY.

  LEPIDUS.
 'Tis so.
 And the tears of it are wet.
 [Aside to MENAS] Go, hang, sir, hang! Tell me of that!
      Away!
    Do as I bid you.
 [Aside to MENAS] I think th'art mad.

  ANTONY.
 These quicksands, Lepidus,
    Keep off them, for you sink.
 Wilt thou be lord of all the world?
  POMPEY.
 In me 'tis villainy:
    In thee't had been good service.
 Repent that e'er thy tongue
    Hath so betray'd thine act.

  POMPEY.
 There's a strong fellow, Menas.
 The third part, then, is drunk.

  MENAS.

  POMPEY.
 This is not yet an Alexandrian feast.

  ANTONY.
 [To ANTONY] Ha, my brave emperor!
    Shall we dance now the Egyptian Bacchanals
    And celebrate our drink?
  POMPEY.

  ANTONY.
 ENOBARBUS places them hand in hand]  

                        THE SONG
            Come, thou monarch of the vine,
            Plumpy Bacchus with pink eyne!
            In thy fats our cares be drown'd,
            With thy grapes our hairs be crown'd.

  POMPEY.

                              Exeunt all but ENOBARBUS and MENAS
    Menas, I'll not on shore.
 Hoo! says 'a.
 There's my cap.
 Now, darting Parthia, art thou struck, and now
    Pleas'd fortune does of Marcus Crassus' death
    Make me revenger.
 So thy grand captain, Antony,
    Shall set thee on triumphant chariots and
    Put garlands on thy head.

  VENTIDIUS.

    Caesar and Antony have ever won
    More in their officer, than person.
 I'll humbly signify what in his name,
    That magical word of war, we have effected;
    How, with his banners, and his well-paid ranks,  
    The ne'er-yet-beaten horse of Parthia
    We have jaded out o' th' field.
 He purposeth to Athens; whither, with what haste
    The weight we must convey with's will permit,
    We shall appear before him.
- On, there; pass along.
 They have dispatch'd with Pompey; he is gone;
    The other three are sealing.
 Octavia weeps
    To part from Rome; Caesar is sad; and Lepidus,
    Since Pompey's feast, as Menas says, is troubled
    With the green sickness.
 Caesar? Why he's the Jupiter of men.
 Would you praise Caesar, say 'Caesar'- go no further.

  AGRIPPA.
 But he loves Caesar best.
 [Trumpets
      within] So-
    This is to horse.
 Sister, prove such a wife
    As my thoughts make thee, and as my farthest band
    Shall pass on thy approof.

  CAESAR.

    The elements be kind to thee and make
    Thy spirits all of comfort! Fare thee well.
 My noble brother!
  ANTONY.
 The April's in her eyes.
 It is love's spring,
    And these the showers to bring it on.
 Be cheerful.

  OCTAVIA.
 [Aside to AGRIPPA] Will Caesar weep?
  AGRIPPA.
 [Aside to ENOBARBUS] He has a cloud in's face.
 Come, sir, come;  
    I'll wrestle with you in my strength of love.

              Alexandria.

  CLEOPATRA.

  ALEXAS.
 Is this certain?
  MESSENGER.
 Three in Egypt
    Cannot make better note.

    The fellow has good judgment.

  CLEOPATRA.
 Round even to faultiness.

  CLEOPATRA.
 There's gold for thee.

    I will employ thee back again; I find thee
    Most fit for business.
 A proper man.

  CLEOPATRA.
 The man hath seen some majesty, and should know.
                         Exeunt

ACT_3|SC_4
                          SCENE IV.
 Nay, nay, Octavia, not only that-
    That were excusable, that and thousands more
    Of semblable import- but he hath wag'd
    New wars 'gainst Pompey; made his will, and read it
    To public ear;
    Spoke scandy of me; when perforce he could not
    But pay me terms of honour, cold and sickly
    He vented them, most narrow measure lent me;
    When the best hint was given him, he not took't,
    Or did it from his teeth.

  OCTAVIA.
 Gentle Octavia,
    Let your best love draw to that point which seeks
    Best to preserve it.
 Make your soonest haste;
    So your desires are yours.
 How now, friend Eros!
  EROS.
 Then, world, thou hast a pair of chaps- no more;
    And throw between them all the food thou hast,
    They'll grind the one the other.
 For Italy and Caesar.

  EROS.
 Contemning Rome, he has done all this and more
    In Alexandria.
 Unto her
    He gave the stablishment of Egypt; made her
    Of lower Syria, Cyprus, Lydia,
    Absolute queen.

  MAECENAS.
 Caesar; and that, having in Sicily
    Sextus Pompeius spoil'd, we had not rated him
    His part o' th' isle.

  CAESAR.
 For what I have conquer'd
    I grant him part; but then, in his Armenia
    And other of his conquer'd kingdoms,
    Demand the like.
 Nor must not then be yielded to in this.
 Hail, Caesar, and my lord! hail, most dear Caesar!
  CAESAR.
 Nay, the dust  
    Should have ascended to the roof of heaven,
    Rais'd by your populous troops.
 We should have met you
    By sea and land, supplying every stage
    With an augmented greeting.
 Which soon he granted,
    Being an obstruct 'tween his lust and him.
 You are abus'd
    Beyond the mark of thought, and the high gods,
    To do you justice, make their ministers
    Of us and those that love you.
 Most certain.
 Pray you
    Be ever known to patience.
 Well, is it, is it?
  CLEOPATRA.
 What is't you say?
  ENOBARBUS.
 Sink Rome, and their tongues rot
    That speak against us! A charge we bear i' th' war,
    And, as the president of my kingdom, will
    Appear there for a man.


                   Enter ANTONY and CANIDIUS

  ENOBARBUS.

  CLEOPATRA.
 So hath my lord dar'd him to single fight.
 No disgrace
    Shall fall you for refusing him at sea,
    Being prepar'd for land.

  ANTONY.
 Our overplus of shipping will we burn,
    And, with the rest full-mann'd, from th' head of Actium
    Beat th' approaching Caesar.

  ANTONY.
 Well, well- away.
 My lord?
  CAESAR.

                  Another part of the plain

                  Enter ANTONY and ENOBARBUS

  ANTONY.

                 Another part of the plain

        CANIDIUS marcheth with his land army one way
        over the stage, and TAURUS, the Lieutenant of
      CAESAR, the other way.
 What's thy passion?
  SCARUS.
 How appears the fight?
  SCARUS.
 That I beheld;
    Mine eyes did sicken at the sight and could not
    Endure a further view.
 Had our general
    Been what he knew himself, it had gone well.

  SCARUS.
 I'll yet follow
    The wounded chance of Antony, though my reason
    Sits in the wind against me.
                          Exeunt

ACT_3|SC_11
                         SCENE XI.

              Alexandria.

    I am so lated in the world that I
    Have lost my way for ever.
 Fly,
    And make your peace with Caesar.
 O Juno!
  ANTONY.

  EROS.

  CLEOPATRA.
 Go to him, madam, speak to him.

    He is unqualitied with very shame.

  CLEOPATRA.
 Well then, sustain me.
 O!
 EROS.
 I have offended reputation-
    A most unnoble swerving.
 Sir, the Queen.
 O my lord, my lord,
    Forgive my fearful sails! I little thought
    You would have followed.
 Now I must
    To the young man send humble treaties, dodge
    And palter in the shifts of lowness, who
    With half the bulk o' th' world play'd as I pleas'd,
    Making and marring fortunes.
 Let him appear that's come from Antony.
 So to them both.

  EUPHRONIUS.
 Bring him through the bands.

  THYREUS.
 Caesar, I shall.
 What shall we do, Enobarbus?
  ENOBARBUS.
 Antony only, that would make his will
    Lord of his reason.
 What though you fled
    From that great face of war, whose several ranges
    Frighted each other? Why should he follow?
    The itch of his affection should not then
    Have nick'd his captainship, at such a point,
    When half to half the world oppos'd, he being
    The mered question.
 'Twas a shame no less
    Than was his loss, to course your flying flags
    And leave his navy gazing.

  CLEOPATRA.
 Prithee, peace.
 He says so.

                                    Exeunt ANTONY and EUPHRONIUS  
  EUPHRONIUS.


                       Enter a SERVANT

  SERVANT.
 Admit him, sir.
 [Aside] Mine honesty and I begin to square.
 None but friends: say boldly.
 So, haply, are they friends to Antony.
 He needs as many, sir, as Caesar has,
    Or needs not us.
 Go on.
 O!
  THYREUS.
 The scars upon your honour, therefore, he
    Does pity, as constrained blemishes,
    Not as deserv'd.
 He is a god, and knows
    What is most right.
                                  Exit
  THYREUS.
 Shall I say to Caesar
    What you require of him? For he partly begs
    To be desir'd to give.
 But it would warm his spirits
    To hear from me you had left Antony,
    And put yourself under his shroud,
    The universal landlord.

  CLEOPATRA.

  CLEOPATRA.
 Give me grace to lay
    My duty on your hand.


                Re-enter ANTONY and ENOBARBUS

  ANTONY.
 Approach there.
 Take him hence.
 Being whipt,
    Bring him again: the Jack of Caesar's shall
    Bear us an errand to him.
 Good my lord-
  ANTONY.

  ANTONY.
 He did ask favour.

  ANTONY.
 If that thy father live, let him repent
    Thou wast not made his daughter; and be thou sorry
    To follow Caesar in his triumph, since
    Thou hast been whipt for following him.

    Hence with thy stripes, be gone.
 Alack, our terrene moon
    Is now eclips'd, and it portends alone
    The fall of Antony.
 Not know me yet?
  ANTONY.
 Cold-hearted toward me?
  CLEOPATRA.

  ANTONY.

    Where hast thou been, my heart? Dost thou hear, lady?
    If from the field I shall return once more
    To kiss these lips, I will appear in blood.

  CLEOPATRA.
 That's my brave lord!
  ANTONY.
 I will be treble-sinew'd, hearted, breath'd,
    And fight maliciously.
 I will seek
    Some way to leave him.
                                  Exit

ACT_4|SC_1
                      ACT IV.
 Give him no breath, but now
    Make boot of his distraction.
 Never anger
    Made good guard for itself.
 Poor Antony!          Exeunt

ACT_4|SC_2
                          SCENE II.

  ANTONY.
 Or I will live,
    Or bathe my dying honour in the blood
    Shall make it live again.


                Enter three or four servitors
  
    Give me thy hand,
    Thou has been rightly honest.
 Well, my good fellows, wait on me to-night.
 [Aside to CLEOPATRA] To make his followers weep.
 I look on you
    As one that takes his leave.
 What mean you, sir,
    To give them this discomfort? Look, they weep;
    And I, an ass, am onion-ey'd.
 Let's to supper, come,
    And drown consideration.
 Nothing.
 Soldiers, have careful watch.

  FIRST SOLDIER.
 Good night, good night.
 List, list!
  SECOND SOLDIER.

  THIRD SOLDIER.

  SECOND SOLDIER.
 Follow the noise so far as we have quarter;
    Let's see how it will give off.
  
  SOLDIERS.
 CLEOPATRA's palace

         Enter ANTONY and CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS,
                          with others

  ANTONY.
 Eros! mine armour, Eros!
  CLEOPATRA.
 Sleep a little.

  CLEOPATRA.

  CLEOPATRA.

    Thou look'st like him that knows a warlike charge.

    To business that we love we rise betime,
    And go to't with delight.

                            [Shout.
 Flourish of trumpets within]

                 Enter CAPTAINS and soldiers

  CAPTAIN.

  ANTONY.

    This morning, like the spirit of a youth
    That means to be of note, begins betimes.
 Well said.
 Would thou and those thy scars had once prevail'd
    To make me fight at land!
  SOLDIER.
 Call for Enobarbus,
    He shall not hear thee; or from Caesar's camp
    Say 'I am none of thine.

  AGRIPPA.

    Prove this a prosp'rous day, the three-nook'd world
    Shall bear the olive freely.
 Go charge Agrippa
    Plant those that have revolted in the vant,
    That Antony may seem to spend his fury
    Upon himself.
 Alexas did revolt and went to Jewry on
    Affairs of Antony; there did dissuade
    Great Herod to incline himself to Caesar
    And leave his master Antony.
 The messenger
    Came on my guard, and at thy tent is now
    Unloading of his mules.
 Your emperor
    Continues still a Jove.

    If swift thought break it not, a swifter mean
    Shall outstrike thought; but thought will do't, I feel.

             Field of battle between the camps

         Alarum.
 We'll beat'em into bench-holes.

  SCARUS.
 Let us score their backs
    And snatch 'em up, as we take hares, behind.

    SCARUS.

               Under the walls of Alexandria

        Alarum.
 We have beat him to his camp.
 Leap thou, attire and all,
    Through proof of harness to my heart, and there
    Ride on the pants triumphing.

  ENOBARBUS.
 Throw my heart
    Against the flint and hardness of my fault,
    Which, being dried with grief, will break to powder,
    And finish all foul thoughts.

  CENTURION.

  SECOND WATCH.
 But he sleeps.

  CENTURION.

  FIRST WATCH.
 Go we to him.
 For both, my lord.

  ANTONY.
 But this it is, our foot
    Upon the hills adjoining to the city
    Shall stay with us- Order for sea is given;
    They have put forth the haven-
    Where their appointment we may best discover
    And look on their endeavour.

                    Between the camps

                Enter CAESAR and his army

  CAESAR.
                          Exeunt

ACT_4|SC_12
                         SCENE XII.
                           Exit
  SCARUS.
 Swallows have built
    In Cleopatra's sails their nests.
 All is lost!
    This foul Egyptian hath betrayed me.
 Triple-turn'd whore! 'tis thou
    Hast sold me to this novice; and my heart
    Makes only wars on thee.
 Bid them all fly;
    For when I am reveng'd upon my charm,
    I have done all.
 Betray'd I am.

    O this false soul of Egypt! this grave charm-
    Whose eye beck'd forth my wars and call'd them home,
    Whose bosom was my crownet, my chief end-
    Like a right gypsy hath at fast and loose
    Beguil'd me to the very heart of loss.
 Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving
    And blemish Caesar's triumph.
 Eros, ho!
    The shirt of Nessus is upon me; teach me,
    Alcides, thou mine ancestor, thy rage;
    Let me lodge Lichas on the horns o' th' moon,
    And with those hands that grasp'd the heaviest club
    Subdue my worthiest self.

               Alexandria.

  CHARMIAN.

    The soul and body rive not more in parting
    Than greatness going off.

                     CLEOPATRA'S palace

                   Enter ANTONY and EROS

  ANTONY.
 Thou hast seen these signs;
    They are black vesper's pageants.


                         Enter MARDIAN

    O, thy vile lady!
    She has robb'd me of my sword.
 No, Antony;
    My mistress lov'd thee, and her fortunes mingled
    With thine entirely.
 Death of one person can be paid but once,
    And that she has discharg'd.
 What thou wouldst do  
    Is done unto thy hand.
 She rend'red life,
    Thy name so buried in her.

  ANTONY.

  ANTONY.
 That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly.
 So it must be, for now  
    All length is torture.
 Since the torch is out,
    Lie down, and stray no farther.
 Now all labour
    Mars what it does; yea, very force entangles
    Itself with strength.

    Dido and her Aeneas shall want troops,
    And all the haunt be ours.
- Come, Eros, Eros!

                       Re-enter EROS

  EROS.

    Thou strik'st not me; 'tis Caesar thou defeat'st.
 Come, then; for with a wound I must be cur'd.
 Turn from me then that noble countenance,
    Wherein the worship of the whole world lies.

  ANTONY.
 My sword is drawn.
 Then let it do at once
    The thing why thou hast drawn it.
 My dear master,
    My captain and my emperor, let me say,
    Before I strike this bloody stroke, farewell.

  ANTONY.
 Let him that loves me, strike me dead.
 Nor I.
 There, Diomed, there.

  ANTONY.

  ANTONY.
 Too late, good Diomed.
 Nay, good my fellows, do not please sharp fate
    To grace it with your sorrows.
           Exeunt, hearing ANTONY
ACT_4|SC_15
                         SCENE XV.


                   Enter DIOMEDES, below

    How now! Is he dead?
  DIOMEDES.

  CLEOPATRA.

    Your wife Octavia, with her modest eyes
    And still conclusion, shall acquire no honour
    Demuring upon me.

  ANTONY.
 Yet come a little.

  CLEOPATRA.

  CLEOPATRA.
 Noblest of men, woo't die?  
    Hast thou no care of me? Shall I abide
    In this dull world, which in thy absence is
    No better than a sty? O, see, my women,        [Antony dies]
    The crown o' th' earth doth melt.
 My lord!
    O, wither'd is the garland of the war,
    The soldier's pole is fall'n! Young boys and girls
    Are level now with men.
 Lady!
  IRAS.
 No more but e'en a woman, and commanded
    By such poor passion as the maid that milks
    And does the meanest chares.
 Caesar, I shall.
 Whilst he stood up and spoke,
    He was my master, and I wore my life
    To spend upon his haters.

  CAESAR.

  CAESAR.
 The death of Antony
    Is not a single doom; in the name lay
    A moiety of the world.

  DERCETAS.

  CAESAR.
 When such a spacious mirror's set before him,
    He needs must see himself.
 Whence are you?
  EGYPTIAN.

  CAESAR.
 Bid her have good heart.
 So the gods preserve thee!                      Exit
  CAESAR.
 Come hither, Proculeius.
 Go and say
    We purpose her no shame.
 Let him alone, for I remember now
    How he's employ'd; he shall in time be ready.

                Alexandria.
 'Tis paltry to be Caesar:
    Not being Fortune, he's but Fortune's knave,
    A minister of her will; and it is great
    To do that thing that ends all other deeds,
    Which shackles accidents and bolts up change,
    Which sleeps, and never palates more the dug,
    The beggar's nurse and Caesar's.
 What's thy name?
  PROCULEIUS.
  
  CLEOPATRA.
 If your master
    Would have a queen his beggar, you must tell him
    That majesty, to keep decorum, must
    No less beg than a kingdom.
                             Exit
  IRAS.
 Let the world see
    His nobleness well acted, which your death
    Will never let come forth.

  CLEOPATRA.
 O, temperance, lady!
  CLEOPATRA.
 Sir, I will eat no meat; I'll not drink, sir;
    If idle talk will once be necessary,
    I'll not sleep neither.
 For the Queen,
    I'll take her to my guard.

    You laugh when boys or women tell their dreams;
    Is't not your trick?
  DOLABELLA.
 Most sovereign creature-
  CLEOPATRA.

  DOLABELLA.
 Cleopatra-
  CLEOPATRA.
 Gentle madam, no.
 You lie, up to the hearing of the gods.

  CLEOPATRA.

  CAESAR.
 Where's Seleucus?
  SELEUCUS.
 Here, madam.
 [To SELEUCUS] Prithee go hence;
    Or I shall show the cinders of my spirits
    Through th' ashes of my chance.
 Still be't yours,
    Bestow it at your pleasure; and believe
    Caesar's no merchant, to make prize with you
    Of things that merchants sold.
 Not so.

    I have spoke already, and it is provided;
    Go put it to the haste.

  CHARMIAN.
 Madam, I will.
 Behold, sir.
 Madam, as thereto sworn by your command,
    Which my love makes religion to obey,
    I tell you this: Caesar through Syria
    Intends his journey, and within three days
    You with your children will he send before.

    Make your best use of this; I have perform'd
    Your pleasure and my promise.
 Mechanic slaves,
    With greasy aprons, rules, and hammers, shall
    Uplift us to the view; in their thick breaths,
    Rank of gross diet, shall we be enclouded,
    And forc'd to drink their vapour.
 Nay, 'tis most certain, Iras.
 O the good gods!
  CLEOPATRA.

  CLEOPATRA.
 Bring our crown and all.
 A noise within
    Wherefore's this noise?

                     Enter a GUARDSMAN

  GUARDSMAN.

    My resolution's plac'd, and I have nothing
    Of woman in me.

  CLEOPATRA.
 Remember'st thou any that have died on't?
  CLOWN.
 Farewell.
 Take thou no care; it shall be heeded.
 Give it nothing, I pray you, for it is not worth
    the feeding.
 I know that a woman is a dish for
    the gods, if the devil dress her not.
 But truly, these same
    whoreson devils do the gods great harm in their women, for in
    every ten that they make the devils mar five.

  CLOWN.
 Husband, I come.
 IRAS falls and dies]
    Have I the aspic in my lips? Dost fall?
    If thus thou and nature can so gently part,
    The stroke of death is as a lover's pinch,
    Which hurts and is desir'd.

  CHARMIAN.
 Come, thou mortal wretch,
                    [To an asp, which she applies to her breast]
    With thy sharp teeth this knot intrinsicate
    Of life at once untie.
 O, break! O, break!
  CLEOPATRA.
 Too slow a messenger.
 What work is here! Charmian, is this well done?
  CHARMIAN.
 Who was last with them?
  FIRST GUARD.
 Poison'd then.

  FIRST GUARD.
 Our army shall
    In solemn show attend this funeral,
    And then to Rome.

  ORLANDO.
 Go apart, Adam, and thou shalt hear how he will shake me
    up.
 Now, sir! what make you here?
  ORLANDO.
 Marry, sir, I am helping you to mar that which God made, a
    poor unworthy brother of yours, with idleness.
 Know you where you are, sir?
  ORLANDO.

  OLIVER.
 I know you are
    my eldest brother; and in the gentle condition of blood, you
    should so know me.
 The courtesy of nations allows you my better
    in that you are the first-born; but the same tradition takes not
    away my blood, were there twenty brothers betwixt us.
 I have as
    much of my father in me as you, albeit I confess your coming
    before me is nearer to his reverence.

  OLIVER.
 What, boy!                               [Strikes him]
  ORLANDO.
 Come, come, elder brother, you are too young in this.

  ADAM.
 Let me go, I say.
 And what wilt thou do? Beg, when that is spent? Well, sir,
    get you in.
 I no further offend you than becomes me for my good.
 Get you with him, you old dog.

                                         Exeunt ORLANDO and ADAM
  OLIVER.
 not Charles, the Duke's wrestler, here to speak with me?
  DENNIS.
 [Exit DENNIS] 'Twill be a good way; and
    to-morrow the wrestling is.


                          Enter CHARLES

  CHARLES.

  OLIVER.
 What, you wrestle to-morrow before the new Duke?
  CHARLES.
 Marry, do I, sir; and I came to acquaint you with a
    matter.

    Your brother is but young and tender; and, for your love, I would
    be loath to foil him, as I must, for my own honour, if he come
    in; therefore, out of my love to you, I came hither to acquaint
    you withal, that either you might stay him from his intendment,  
    or brook such disgrace well as he shall run into, in that it is
    thing of his own search and altogether against my will.

    Therefore use thy discretion: I had as lief thou didst break his
    neck as his finger.
 Farewell, good Charles.
 But it shall not be so long; this wrestler
    shall clear all.
 I pray thee, Rosalind, sweet my coz, be merry.
 Dear Celia, I show more mirth than I am mistress of; and
    would you yet I were merrier? Unless you could teach me to forget
    a banished father, you must not learn me how to remember any
    extraordinary pleasure.
 Well, I will forget the condition of my estate, to
    rejoice in yours.

  ROSALIND.

    Let me see; what think you of falling in love?
  CELIA.

  ROSALIND.
 Peradventure this is not Fortune's work neither, but
    Nature's, who perceiveth our natural wits too dull to reason of
    such goddesses, and hath sent this natural for our whetstone; for
    always the dullness of the fool is the whetstone of the wits.
 Were you made the messenger?
  TOUCHSTONE.
 Where learned you that oath, fool?
  TOUCHSTONE.
 Ay, marry, now unmuzzle your wisdom.

  CELIA.

  TOUCHSTONE.
 The more pity that fools may not speak wisely what wise
    men do foolishly.
 Here comes Monsieur Le Beau.

  CELIA.
 Bon jour,
    Monsieur Le Beau.
 What's the news?
  LE BEAU.
 Thou losest thy old smell.
 I would have told you of good
    wrestling, which you have lost the sight of.
 Well, the beginning, that is dead and buried.

  LE BEAU.
 I could match this beginning with an old tale.

  ROSALIND.
 The eldest of the three wrestled with Charles, the Duke's
    wrestler; which Charles in a moment threw him, and broke three of
    his ribs, that there is little hope of life in him.
 Alas!
  TOUCHSTONE.
 But what is the sport, monsieur, that the ladies have
    lost?
  LE BEAU.
 It is the first time
    that ever I heard breaking of ribs was sport for ladies.
 But is there any else longs to see this broken music in
    his sides? Is there yet another dotes upon rib-breaking? Shall we
    see this wrestling, cousin?
  LE BEAU.

  CELIA.

  FREDERICK.
 Monsieur the Challenger, the Princess calls for you.

  ORLANDO.
 I attend them with all respect and duty.

  ROSALIND.

  ROSALIND.
  
  ORLANDO.
 But let your fair eyes and gentle wishes go
    with me to my trial; wherein if I be foil'd there is but one
    sham'd that was never gracious; if kill'd, but one dead that is
    willing to be so.
 Fare you well.
 Come, where is this young gallant that is so desirous to
    lie with his mother earth?
  ORLANDO.
 I would I were invisible, to catch the strong fellow by the
    leg.
 O excellent young man!
  CELIA.
 Yes, I beseech your Grace; I am not yet well breath'd.
 Orlando, my liege; the youngest son of Sir Rowland de
    Boys.

    Thou shouldst have better pleas'd me with this deed,  
    Hadst thou descended from another house.

                                 Exeunt DUKE, train, and LE BEAU
  CELIA.

  CELIA.
 Sir, you have well deserv'd;
    If you do keep your promises in love
    But justly as you have exceeded all promise,
    Your mistress shall be happy.
  
  ROSALIND.

  ROSALIND.
 Have with you.
 What passion hangs these weights upon my tongue?
    I cannot speak to her, yet she urg'd conference.
 Sir, fare you well.

                                                    Exit LE BEAU
    Thus must I from the smoke into the smother;
    From tyrant Duke unto a tyrant brother.

  CELIA.
 I could shake them off my coat: these burs are in my
    heart.

  CELIA.
 Is it possible, on such a sudden, you should fall
    into so strong a liking with old Sir Rowland's youngest son?
  ROSALIND.
 No, faith, hate him not, for my sake.
 Let me love him for that; and do you love him because I
    do.

  CELIA.
 Mistress, dispatch you with your safest haste,
    And get you from our court.
 You, cousin.

    Within these ten days if that thou beest found
    So near our public court as twenty miles,
    Thou diest for it.
 Thus do all traitors;
    If their purgation did consist in words,
    They are as innocent as grace itself.

    Treason is not inherited, my lord;
    Or, if we did derive it from our friends,
    What's that to me? My father was no traitor.

  CELIA.
 Thou hast not, cousin.
 Were it not better,  
    Because that I am more than common tall,
    That I did suit me all points like a man?
    A gallant curtle-axe upon my thigh,
    A boar spear in my hand; and- in my heart
    Lie there what hidden woman's fear there will-
    We'll have a swashing and a martial outside,
    As many other mannish cowards have
    That do outface it with their semblances.

  CELIA.
 But, cousin, what if we assay'd to steal
    The clownish fool out of your father's court?
    Would he not be a comfort to our travel?
  CELIA.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.
