    And at that time bequeath you my diseases.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.
>>



SCENE:
A city in Illyria; and the sea-coast near it



ACT I.

The DUKE'S palace

Enter ORSINO, Duke of Illyria, CURIO, and other LORDS; MUSICIANS attending

  DUKE.

    O, when mine eyes did see Olivia first,
    Methought she purg'd the air of pestilence!
    That instant was I turn'd into a hart,
    And my desires, like fell and cruel hounds,
    E'er since pursue me.

                                                          Exeunt




SCENE II.

The sea-coast

Enter VIOLA, a CAPTAIN, and SAILORS

  VIOLA.
 True, madam, and, to comfort you with chance,
    Assure yourself, after our ship did split,
    When you, and those poor number saved with you,
    Hung on our driving boat, I saw your brother,
    Most provident in peril, bind himself-
    Courage and hope both teaching him the practice-
    To a strong mast that liv'd upon the sea;
    Where, like Arion on the dolphin's back,
    I saw him hold acquaintance with the waves
    So long as I could see.
 For saying so, there's gold.

  VIOLA.
 What's she?
  CAPTAIN.
 A virtuous maid, the daughter of a count
    That died some twelvemonth since, then leaving her  
    In the protection of his son, her brother,
    Who shortly also died; for whose dear love,
    They say, she hath abjur'd the company
    And sight of men.

  VIOLA.
 That were hard to compass,
    Because she will admit no kind of suit-
    No, not the Duke's.
 There is a fair behaviour in thee, Captain;
    And though that nature with a beauteous wall
    Doth oft close in pollution, yet of thee
    I will believe thou hast a mind that suits
    With this thy fair and outward character.
 Ay, but you must confine yourself within the modest limits
    of order.

  MARIA.

  SIR TOBY.
 Fie that you'll say so! He plays o' th' viol-de-gamboys,
    and speaks three or four languages word for word without book,
    and hath all the good gifts of nature.

  MARIA.
 Who are they?
  MARIA.


                    Enter SIR ANDREW AGUECHEEK  

  AGUECHEEK.

  AGUECHEEK.
 Good Mistress Accost, I desire better acquaintance.

    Is that the meaning of 'accost'?
  MARIA.
 Fare you well, gentlemen.
 It's dry, sir.

  AGUECHEEK.
 Are you full of them?
  MARIA.
 O knight, thou lack'st a cup of canary! When did I see
    thee so put down?
  AGUECHEEK.
 Never in your life, I think; unless you see canary put
    me down.
 Then hadst thou had an excellent head of hair.

  AGUECHEEK.
 Tut, there's life in't, man.

  SIR TOBY.
 Faith, I can cut a caper.

  SIR TOBY.
 And I think I have the back-trick simply as strong as
    any man in Illyria.

  AGUECHEEK.
 Let me see the caper.
 Ha,
    higher! Ha, ha, excellent!                            Exeunt




SCENE IV.
 Here comes the Count.

  DUKE.

  VIOLA.

  VIOLA.
 O, then unfold the passion of my love,
    Surprise her with discourse of my dear faith!
    It shall become thee well to act my woes:
    She will attend it better in thy youth
    Than in a nuncio's of more grave aspect.
 I think not so, my lord.
 [Aside] Yet, a barful strife!
    Whoe'er I woo, myself would be his wife.

OLIVIA'S house

Enter MARIA and CLOWN

  MARIA.
 Nay, either tell me where thou hast been, or I will not open
    my lips so wide as a bristle may enter in way of thy excuse; my
    lady will hang thee for thy absence.
 Let her hang me.
 I can tell thee where that saying was
    born, of 'I fear no colours.
 Where, good Mistress Mary?
  MARIA.

  CLOWN.

  MARIA.

  MARIA.
 For what says
    Quinapalus? 'Better a witty fool than a foolish wit.
 Take the fool away.

  CLOWN.

  OLIVIA.

  OLIVIA.
 Well, sir, for want of other idleness, I'll bide your
    proof.

  OLIVIA.
 The more fool, madonna, to mourn for your brother's soul
    being in heaven.

  CLOWN.

  OLIVIA.
 Sir Toby, madam, your kinsman.

  OLIVIA.

  CLOWN.
 There's one at the gate.
 Let him be the devil an he will, I care not; give me
    faith, say I.
  
  OLIVIA.

  OLIVIA.
 He is very well-favour'd, and he speaks very shrewishly; one
    would think his mother's milk were scarce out of him.
 Call in my gentlewoman.
                     Exit

                          Re-enter MARIA

  OLIVIA.
 Give me my veil; come, throw it o'er my face;  
    We'll once more hear Orsino's embassy.
 Speak to me; I shall answer for her.
 Most radiant, exquisite, and unmatchable beauty- I pray you
    tell me if this be the lady of the house, for I never saw her.
 Good
    beauties, let me sustain no scorn; I am very comptible, even to
    the least sinister usage.
 Whence came you, sir?
  VIOLA.
 Are you a comedian?
  VIOLA.
 No, my profound heart; and yet, by the very fangs of malice
    I swear, I am not that I play.

  OLIVIA.
 It alone concerns your ear.

  OLIVIA.
 What I am and what I would are as secret as
    maidenhead- to your cars, divinity; to any other's, profanation.
 Have you any commission from your lord to negotiate with my
    face? You are now out of your text; but we will draw the curtain
    and show you the picture.

  VIOLA.
 You might do much.
 Fare you well.
 I am no fee'd post, lady; keep your purse;
    My master, not myself, lacks recompense.
 Not too fast! Soft, soft!  
    Unless the master were the man.
 Madam, I will.
 I do I know not what, and fear to find
    Mine eye too great a flatterer for my mind.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.
 No, sooth, sir; my determinate voyage is mere
    extravagancy.
 You must know of me then, Antonio, my name is Sebastian,
    which I call'd Roderigo; my father was that Sebastian of
    Messaline whom I know you have heard of.
 Alas the day!
  SEBASTIAN.
 A lady, sir, though it was said she much resembled me,
    was yet of many accounted beautiful; but though I could not with
    such estimable wonder overfar believe that, yet thus far I will
    boldly publish her: she bore mind that envy could not but call
    fair.
 Pardon me, sir, your bad entertainment.

  SEBASTIAN.
            Exit




SCENE II.
 Were you not ev'n now with the Countess Olivia?
  VIOLA.
 Receive it so.
 Come, sir, you peevishly threw it to her; and her will is
    it should be so return'd.
 If it be so- as 'tis-
    Poor lady, she were better love a dream.

    Disguise, I see thou art a wickedness
    Wherein the pregnant enemy does much.

OLIVIA'S house

Enter SIR TOBY and SIR ANDREW

  SIR TOBY.
 Nay, by my troth, I know not; but I know to be up late
    is to be up late.

  SIR TOBY.

  SIR TOBY.

  AGUECHEEK.
 I had
    rather than forty shillings I had such a leg, and so sweet a
    breath to sing, as the fool has.
 I did impeticos thy gratillity; for Malvolio's nose is no
    whipstock.

  AGUECHEEK.
 Excellent! Why, this is the best fooling, when all is
    done.
 Now, a song.

  SIR TOBY.

           In delay there lies no plenty,
           Then come kiss me, sweet and twenty;
             Youth's a stuff will not endure.
 A contagious breath.
 But shall
    we make the welkin dance indeed? Shall we rouse the night-owl in
    a catch that will draw three souls out of one weaver? Shall we do
    that?
  AGUECHEEK.
'
  CLOWN.
 Begin, fool: it begins 'Hold thy peace.
 I shall never begin if I hold my peace.
                                                [Sings]
              There dwelt a man in Babylon,
              Lady, lady.
 Beshrew me, the knight's in admirable fooling.

  AGUECHEEK.
 Sneck up!
  MALVOLIO.

  SIR TOBY.
 Nay, good Sir Toby.
 [Sings] His eyes do show his days are almost done.
 This is much credit to you.
 [Sings] O, no, no, no, no, you dare not.
 'Twere as good a deed as to drink when a man's ahungry,
    to challenge him the field, and then to break promise with him
    and make a fool of him.

  MARIA.
 I know I can
    do it.

  AGUECHEEK.

  SIR TOBY.
 Sport royal, I warrant you.
 I will plant you two, and let the fool make a third, where
    he shall find the letter; observe his construction of it.
 I was ador'd once too.

  AGUECHEEK.

  SIR TOBY.
 Now, good morrow, friends.
 Who was it?
  CURIO.
 A little, by your favour.
 About your years, my lord.
                               [Music]  

                     FESTE'S SONG

            Come away, come away, death;
          And in sad cypress let me be laid;
            Fly away, fly away, breath,
          I am slain by a fair cruel maid.

  CLOWN.
 No pains, sir; I take pleasure in singing, sir.

  CLOWN.
 Now the melancholy god protect thee; and the tailor make thy
    doublet of changeable taffeta, for thy mind is a very opal.
 I
    would have men of such constancy put to sea, that their business
    might be everything, and their intent everywhere: for that's it
    that always makes a good voyage of nothing.

                                     Exeunt CURIO and ATTENDANTS
    Once more, Cesario,
    Get thee to yond same sovereign cruelty.
 Must she not then be answer'd?
  DUKE.

    Alas, their love may be call'd appetite-
    No motion of the liver, but the palate-
    That suffer surfeit, cloyment, and revolt;
    But mine is all as hungry as the sea,
    And can digest as much.
 Make no compare
    Between that love a woman can bear me
    And that I owe Olivia.
 What dost thou know?
  VIOLA.
 She pin'd in thought;
    And with a green and yellow melancholy
    She sat like Patience on a monument,
    Smiling at grief.

OLIVIA'S garden

Enter SIR TOBY, SIR ANDREW, and FABIAN

  SIR TOBY.
 I would exult, man; you know he brought me out o' favour
    with my lady about a bear-baiting here.
 Here comes the little villain.

    How now, my metal of India!
  MARIA.
 Observe him, for the love of
    mockery, for I know this letter will make a contemplative idiot
    of him.
 Maria once told me she
    did affect me; and I have heard herself come thus near, that,
    should she fancy, it should be one of my complexion.
 O, peace! Contemplation makes a rare turkey-cock of him;
    how he jets under his advanc'd plumes!
  AGUECHEEK.
 O, peace! Now he's deeply in; look how imagination blows
    him.

  MALVOLIO.
 Calling my officers about me, in my branch'd velvet gown,
    having come from a day-bed- where I have left Olivia sleeping-
  SIR TOBY.
 O, peace, peace, peace! Now, now.
 Seven of my people, with an obedient start, make out for
    him.
 And does not Toby take you a blow o' the lips then?
  MALVOLIO.

  MALVOLIO.
 Now is the woodcock near the gin.
 O, peace! And the spirit of humours intimate reading
    aloud to him!
  MALVOLIO.
 Soft! And the
    impressure her Lucrece with which she uses to seal; 'tis my lady.
' What follows? The numbers alter'd!
    'No man must know.
 [Reads]

             'I may command where I adore;
               But silence, like a Lucrece knife,
             With bloodless stroke my heart doth gore;
               M.
 O.
 Excellent wench, say I.
' Why, she may command me: I
    serve her; she is my lady.
 Why, this is evident to any formal
    capacity; there is no obstruction in this.
 Sowter will cry upon't for all this, though it be as rank
    as a fox.

  MALVOLIO.
 Did not I say he would work it out?
    The cur is excellent at faults.

  FABIAN.
 And O shall end, I hope.
 Ay, or I'll cudgel him, and make him cry 'O!'
  MALVOLIO.
 And then I comes behind.
 Remember who commended thy yellow stockings, and
    wish'd to see thee ever cross-garter'd.
 I will be strange, stout, in
    yellow stockings, and cross-garter'd, even with the swiftness of
    putting on.
 Jove and my stars be praised! Here is yet a
    postscript.
                                           Exit
  FABIAN.

  SIR TOBY.

  
                          Enter MARIA

  AGUECHEEK.

  FABIAN.
 Wilt thou set thy foot o' my neck?
  AGUECHEEK.
 Nay, but say true; does it work upon him?
  SIR TOBY.
 He will come to her in yellow
    stockings, and 'tis a colour she abhors, and cross-garter'd, a
    fashion she detests; and he will smile upon her, which will now
    be so unsuitable to her disposition, being addicted to a
    melancholy as she is, that it cannot but turn him into a notable
    contempt.
 I'll make one too.
>>



ACT III.
 Save thee, friend, and thy music!
    Dost thou live by thy tabor?
  CLOWN.
 To see this age! A sentence is but a
    chev'ril glove to a good wit.
 Why, sir, her name's a word; and to dally with that word  
    might make my sister wanton.

  CLOWN.

  VIOLA.
 I am
    indeed not her fool, but her corrupter of words.

  VIOLA.
 Would not a pair of these have bred, sir?
  VIOLA.

  VIOLA.
 I understand you, sir; 'tis well begg'd.
 The matter, I hope, is not great, sir, begging but a beggar:
    Cressida was a beggar.

                                                      Exit CLOWN
  VIOLA.

  SIR TOBY.
 I am bound to your niece, sir; I mean, she is the list of my
    voyage.
 Taste your legs, sir; put them to motion.
 I will answer you with gait and entrance.
 That youth's a rare courtier- 'Rain odours' well!
  VIOLA.
 'Odours,' 'pregnant,' and 'vouchsafed'- I'll get 'em all
    three all ready.
 What is your name?
  VIOLA.
 My servant, sir! 'Twas never merry world
    Since lowly feigning was call'd compliment.
  
  VIOLA.
 Dear lady-
  OLIVIA.

    O world, how apt the poor are to be proud!
    If one should be a prey, how much the better
    To fall before the lion than the wolf!       [Clock strikes]
    The clock upbraids me with the waste of time.

    Be not afraid, good youth; I will not have you;
    And yet, when wit and youth is come to harvest,
    Your wife is like to reap a proper man.

  VIOLA.

  VIOLA.
 Then think you right: I am not what I am.
 By innocence I swear, and by my youth,
    I have one heart, one bosom, and one truth,
    And that no woman has; nor never none
    Shall mistress be of it, save I alone.

  SIR TOBY.
 Thy reason, dear venom, give thy reason.
 As plain as I see you now.
 This was a great argument of love in her toward you.
 The double gilt of
    this opportunity you let time wash off, and you are now sail'd
    into the north of my lady's opinion; where you will hang like an
    icicle on Dutchman's beard, unless you do redeem it by some
    laudable attempt either of valour or policy.

  AGUECHEEK.
 An't be any way, it must be with valour, for policy I
    hate; I had as lief be a Brownist as a politician.
 My niece shall take note of it; and assure
    thyself there is no love-broker in the world can more prevail in
    man's commendation with woman than report of valour.

  FABIAN.
 We'll call thee at the cubiculo.
 This is a dear manakin to you, Sir Toby.
 He does obey every
    point of the letter that I dropp'd to betray him.
 I would not by my will have troubled you;
    But since you make your pleasure of your pains,
    I will no further chide you.

  SEBASTIAN.
 To-morrow, sir; best first go see your lodging.
 Belike you slew great number of his people.
Th' offence is not of such a bloody nature;
    Albeit the quality of the time and quarrel
    Might well have given us bloody argument.

    It might have since been answer'd in repaying
    What we took from them; which, for traffic's sake,
    Most of our city did.

  SEBASTIAN.
 Why I your purse?
  ANTONIO.
 I do remember.
                               Exeunt




SCENE IV.
 I have sent after him; he says he'll come.

    How shall I feast him? What bestow of him?
    For youth is bought more oft than begg'd or borrow'd.

    Where is Malvolio?
  MARIA.
 He's coming, madam; but in very strange manner.
 No, madam, he does nothing but smile.

  MALVOLIO.
 Why, how dost thou, man? What is the matter with thee?
  MALVOLIO.
 Not black in my mind, though yellow in my legs.
 To bed? Ay, sweetheart, and I'll come to thee.
 What mean'st thou by that, Malvolio?
  AIALVOLIO.
 'Some are born great,'-
  OLIVIA.
 'Some achieve greatness,'-
  OLIVIA.
'
  OLIVIA.
 'Thy yellow stockings?'
  MALVOLIO.
 'And wish'd to see thee cross-garterd.
 'If not, let me see thee a servant still.

  OLIVIA.

    Let me alone.
 Carry his water to th' wise woman.

  MARIA.
 Ay, Biddy, come with me.
 Get him to say his prayers, good Sir Toby, get him to pray.
 My prayers, minx!
  MARIA.
 Go, hang yourselves all! You are idle shallow things; I
    am not of your element; you shall know more hereafter.

  MARIA.
 The house will be the quieter.
 My niece
    is already in the belief that he's mad.
 Is't so saucy?
  AGUECHEEK.

  SIR TOBY.
 [Reads] 'Wonder not, nor admire not in thy mind, why I do
    call thee so, for I will show thee no reason for't.
 Very brief, and to exceeding good sense- less.
 'Thou kill'st me like a rogue and a villain.
 Still you keep o' th' windy side of the law.
 [Reads] 'Fare thee well; and God have mercy upon one of
    our souls! He may have mercy upon mine; but my hope is better,
    and so look to thyself.
 Thy friend, as thou usest him, and thy
    sworn enemy,
                                              ANDREW AGUECHEEK.

  SIR TOBY.
 Nay, let me alone for swearing.
 This
    will so fright them both that they will kill one another by the
    look, like cockatrices.


                Re-enter OLIVIA.

    What shall you ask of me that I'll deny,
    That honour sav'd may upon asking give?
  VIOLA.

  OLIVIA.
 I will acquit you.

  OLIVIA.

  VIOLA.
 And you, sir.

  VIOLA.
 Will you
    walk towards him? I will make your peace with him if I can.
  
  VIOLA.


              Re-enter FABIAN and VIOLA

    [To FABIAN] I have his horse to take up the quarrel; I have
    persuaded him the youth's a devil.

  VIOLA.

  VIOLA.
 He will bear you easily and reins well.

  ANTONIO.
 [To VIOLA] This comes with seeking you;
    But there's no remedy; I shall answer it.

    What will you do, now my necessity
    Makes me to ask you for my purse? It grieves me
    Much more for what I cannot do for you
    Than what befalls myself.
 You stand amaz'd;
    But be of comfort.
 My having is not much;
    I'll make division of my present with you;
    Hold, there's half my coffer.

  FIRST OFFICER.
 What's that to us? The time goes by; away.

    Virtue is beauty; but the beauteous evil
    Are empty trunks, o'erflourish'd by the devil.

  FIRST OFFICER.
 Lead me on.
 Come hither, knight; come hither, Fabian; we'll whisper
    o'er a couplet or two of most sage saws.

  FABIAN.
 And I do not-                                  Exit
  FABIAN.

  SEBASTIAN.
 Vent my folly! I am afraid this great
    lubber, the world, will prove a cockney.
 By my troth, thou hast an open hand.

  AGUECHEEK.
 I'll go another way to work with
    him; I'll have an action of battery against him, if there be any
    law in Illyria; though I struck him first, yet it's no matter for
    that.
 I will be free from thee.
     [Draws]
  SIR TOBY.
 What relish is in this? How runs the stream?
    Or I am mad, or else this is a dream.

    Let fancy still my sense in Lethe steep;
    If it be thus to dream, still let me sleep!
  OLIVIA.
 Nay, I prithee, put on this gown and this beard; make him
    believe thou art Sir Topas the curate; do it quickly.


                 Enter SIR TOBY and MARIA

  SIR TOBY.

  CLOWN.
 What ho, I say! Peace in this prison!
  SIR TOBY.
 The knave counterfeits well; a good knave.

  MALVOLIO.

  CLOWN.
 Out, hyperbolical fiend! How vexest thou this man!
    Talkest thou nothing but of ladies?
  SIR TOBY.
 Fie, thou dishonest Satan! I call thee by the most modest
    terms, for I am one of those gentle ones that will use the devil
    himself with courtesy.
  
  CLOWN.

  MALVOLIO.
 What think'st thou of his opinion?
  MALVOLIO.

  CLOWN.
 Fare thee well.

  MARIA.
 To him in thine own voice, and bring me word how thou
    find'st him.
 I would we were well rid of this knavery.
 Come by and by to my chamber.

  MALVOLIO.
 Fool!
  CLOWN.
 [Sings] She loves another- Who calls, ha?
  MALVOLIO.
  
  CLOWN.
 Fool, there was never man so notoriously abus'd;
    I am as well in my wits, fool, as thou art.
 But as well? Then you are mad indeed, if you be no better in
    your wits than a fool.
 Sir Topas!
  CLOWN.
- Who, I, sir? Not
    I, sir.
- I will sir, I
    will.

  MALVOLIO.
 Good fool, help me to some light and some paper.
  
  CLOWN.
 Fool, I'll requite it in the highest degree; I prithe be
    gone.

  CLOWN.
 Blame not this haste of mine.
 Then lead the way, good father; and heavens so shine  
    That they may fairly note this act of mine!           Exeunt




<<THIS ELECTRONIC VERSION OF THE COMPLETE WORKS OF WILLIAM
SHAKESPEARE IS COPYRIGHT 1990-1993 BY WORLD LIBRARY, INC.
 Now, as thou lov'st me, let me see his letter.
 Good Master Fabian, grant me another request.
 This is to give a dog, and in recompense desire my dog
    again.
 Just the contrary: the better for thy friends.

  CLOWN.
 How can that be?  
  CLOWN.

  DUKE.

  DUKE.
 Thou shalt not be the worse for me.

  DUKE.

  CLOWN.
 Marry, sir, lullaby to your bounty till I come again.
 But, as you say, sir, let your bounty
    take a nap; I will awake it anon.
                       Exit

                 Enter ANTONIO and OFFICERS

  VIOLA.
 Here comes the man, sir, that did rescue me.
 Orsino, this is that Antonio
    That took the Phoenix and her fraught from Candy;
    And this is he that did the Tiger board
    When your young nephew Titus lost his leg.

    Here in the streets, desperate of shame and state,
    In private brabble did we apprehend him.
 Notable pirate, thou salt-water thief!
    What foolish boldness brought thee to their mercies
    Whom thou, in terms so bloody and so dear,
    Hast made thine enemies?
  ANTONIO.
 When came he to this town?
  ANTONIO.

    Three months this youth hath tended upon me-
    But more of that anon.
 What do you say, Cesario? Good my lord-
  VIOLA.

  DUKE.
 Even what it please my lord, that shall become him.
 But hear me this:
    Since you to non-regardance cast my faith,
    And that I partly know the instrument
    That screws me from my true place in your favour,
    Live you the marble-breasted tyrant still;
    But this your minion, whom I know you love,
    And whom, by heaven I swear, I tender dearly,
    Him will I tear out of that cruel eye
    Where he sits crowned in his master's spite.

  VIOLA.
 Where goes Cesario?
  VIOLA.
                Exit an ATTENDANT
  DUKE.
 No, my lord, not I.

  OLIVIA.

    Fear not, Cesario, take thy fortunes up;  
    Be that thou know'st thou art, and then thou art
    As great as that thou fear'st.
 For the love of God, a surgeon!
    Send one presently to Sir Toby.
 Has broke my head across, and has given Sir Toby a
    bloody coxcomb too.
 Who has done this, Sir Andrew?
  AGUECHEEK.
  
  DUKE.
 Od's lifelings, here he is! You broke my head for
    nothing; and that that did, I was set on to do't by Sir Toby.
 Why do you speak to me? I never hurt you.

    You drew your sword upon me without cause;
    But I bespake you fair and hurt you not.
 How now, gentleman? How is't with you?
  SIR TOBY.
 That's all one; has hurt me, and there's th' end on't.
 I'll help you, Sir Toby, because we'll be dress'd
    together.

  SIR TOBY.
 I am sorry, madam, I have hurt your kinsman;
    But, had it been the brother of my blood,
    I must have done no less with wit and safety.

    You throw a strange regard upon me, and by that
    I do perceive it hath offended you.

  SEBASTIAN.

  SEBASTIAN.

  VIOLA.
 Be not amaz'd; right noble is his blood.

  DUKE.
 Give me thy hand;
    And let me see thee in thy woman's weeds.

  VIOLA.
 He, upon some action,  
    Is now in durance, at Malvolio's suit,
    A gentleman and follower of my lady's.

  OLIVIA.

    How does he, sirrah?
  CLOWN.

  OLIVIA.
 Open't, and read it.

  CLOWN.
 How now! Art thou mad?  
  CLOWN.
 An your ladyship will have
    it as it ought to be, you must allow vox.
 Though you have put me into darkness and given
    your drunken cousin rule over me, yet have I the benefit of my
    senses as well as your ladyship.
 A sister! You are she.
 Is this the madman?
  OLIVIA.

  OLIVIA.
 Have I, Malvolio? No.

    You must not now deny it is your hand;
    Write from it if you can, in hand or phrase;
    Or say 'tis not your seal, not your invention;
    You can say none of this.
 Alas, Malvolio, this is not my writing,
    Though, I confess, much like the character;  
    But out of question 'tis Maria's hand.

  FABIAN.
 Alas, poor fool, how have they baffl'd thee!
  CLOWN.
 'By the Lord,
    fool, I am not mad!' But do you remember- 'Madam, why laugh you
    at such a barren rascal? An you smile not, he's gagg'd'? And thus
    the whirligig of time brings in his revenges.
 I'll be reveng'd on the whole pack of you.
 Meantime, sweet sister,
    We will not part from hence.
 Cesario, come;
    For so you shall be while you are a man;  
    But when in other habits you are seen,
    Orsino's mistress, and his fancy's queen.


           But when I came to man's estate,
             With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,
           'Gainst knaves and thieves men shut their gate,
             For the rain it raineth every day.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.

SCENE:  
Verona; Milan; the frontiers of Mantua


ACT I.
 Cease to persuade, my loving Proteus:
    Home-keeping youth have ever homely wits.

    Were't not affection chains thy tender days
    To the sweet glances of thy honour'd love,
    I rather would entreat thy company
    To see the wonders of the world abroad,
    Than, living dully sluggardiz'd at home,
    Wear out thy youth with shapeless idleness.

  VALENTINE.
 That's on some shallow story of deep love:
    How young Leander cross'd the Hellespont.

  PROTEUS.
 No, I will not, for it boots thee not.

  PROTEUS.
  
  VALENTINE.
 'Tis love you cavil at; I am not Love.

  PROTEUS.
 And thither will I bring thee, Valentine.

  VALENTINE.
 All happiness bechance to thee in Milan!
  VALENTINE.
 Indeed a sheep doth very often stray,
    An if the shepherd be awhile away.
 You conclude that my master is a shepherd then, and
    I a sheep?
  PROTEUS.
 A silly answer, and fitting well a sheep.
 This proves me still a sheep.
 Nay, that I can deny by a circumstance.

  PROTEUS.
 Such another proof will make me cry 'baa.
 Ay, sir; I, a lost mutton, gave your letter to her, a lac'd
    mutton; and she, a lac'd mutton, gave me, a lost mutton, nothing
    for my labour.

  PROTEUS.
  [Nodding]  Ay.
 And that set together is 'noddy.
 Marry, sir, the letter, very orderly; having nothing but the
    word 'noddy' for my pains.

  PROTEUS.
 Well, sir, here is for your pains.

  PROTEUS.
         Exit SPEED
    I must go send some better messenger.

Verona.
 But say, Lucetta, now we are alone,
    Wouldst thou then counsel me to fall in love?
  LUCETTA.
 Well of his wealth; but of himself, so so.
 Lord, Lord! to see what folly reigns in us!
  JULIA.
 How now! what means this passion at his name?
  LUCETTA.
 Pardon, dear madam; 'tis a passing shame  
    That I, unworthy body as I am,
    Should censure thus on lovely gentlemen.

  JULIA.
 I have no other but a woman's reason:
    I think him so, because I think him so.

  JULIA.

  LUCETTA.

  JULIA.
 Now, by my modesty, a goodly broker!
    Dare you presume to harbour wanton lines?
    To whisper and conspire against my youth?
    Now, trust me, 'tis an office of great worth,
    And you an officer fit for the place.

    There, take the paper; see it be return'd;
    Or else return no more into my sight.

  JULIA.
  
  JULIA.
 Nothing concerning me.

  LUCETTA.

  JULIA.

  LUCETTA.
 She makes it strange; but she would be best pleas'd
    To be so ang'red with another letter.

    Lo, here in one line is his name twice writ:
    'Poor forlorn Proteus, passionate Proteus,
    To the sweet Julia.
 If you respect them, best to take them up.

  JULIA.
 ANTONIO'S house

Enter ANTONIO and PANTHINO

  ANTONIO.
 Why, what of him?
  PANTHINO.
 He wond'red that your lordship
    Would suffer him to spend his youth at home,
    While other men, of slender reputation,
    Put forth their sons to seek preferment out:
    Some to the wars, to try their fortune there;
    Some to discover islands far away;
    Some to the studious universities.
 'Twere good, I think, your lordship sent him thither:
    There shall he practise tilts and tournaments,
    Hear sweet discourse, converse with noblemen,
    And be in eye of every exercise
    Worthy his youth and nobleness of birth.
 I like thy counsel; well hast thou advis'd;
    And that thou mayst perceive how well I like it,
    The execution of it shall make known:  
    Even with the speediest expedition
    I will dispatch him to the Emperor's court.

  PANTHINO.
 How now! What letter are you reading there?
  PROTEUS.
 May't please your lordship, 'tis a word or two
    Of commendations sent from Valentine,  
    Deliver'd by a friend that came from him.

  ANTONIO.
 My lord, I cannot be so soon provided;
    Please you, deliberate a day or two.
  
  ANTONIO.
  
  PROTEUS.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.
 SCENE I.

Milan.
 Sir, your glove.

  VALENTINE.
 Not mine: my gloves are on.
 Why, then, this may be yours; for this is but one.
 Ha! let me see; ay, give it me, it's mine;
    Sweet ornament that decks a thing divine!
    Ah, Silvia! Silvia!
  SPEED.

  VALENTINE.

  SPEED.
 Why, sir, I know her not.
 Is she not hard-favour'd, sir?
  VALENTINE.
 What dost thou know?
  SPEED.

  VALENTINE.

  VALENTINE.

  VALENTINE.
 Why?
  SPEED.
 O that you had mine eyes; or your own
    eyes had the lights they were wont to have when you chid at Sir
    Proteus for going ungarter'd!
  VALENTINE.

  SPEED.

  SPEED.

  SPEED.

  SPEED.
 As you enjoin'd me, I have writ your letter
    Unto the secret nameless friend of yours;
    Which I was much unwilling to proceed in,
    But for my duty to your ladyship.
 Ay, ay, you writ them, sir, at my request;
    But I will none of them; they are for you:  
    I would have had them writ more movingly.
 Please you, I'll write your ladyship another.

  SILVIA.

  VALENTINE.
 To whom?
  SPEED.
 To yourself; why, she woos you by a figure.

  VALENTINE.

  SPEED.

  SPEED.
 Ay, but hearken, sir; though the chameleon Love can feed on
    the air, I am one that am nourish'd by my victuals, and would
    fain have meat.
 Have patience, gentle Julia.

  JULIA.

  PROTEUS.
 Here, take you this.

  PROTEUS.

    Julia, farewell!                                  Exit JULIA  
    What, gone without a word?
    Ay, so true love should do: it cannot speak;
    For truth hath better deeds than words to grace it.

    Alas! this parting strikes poor lovers dumb.

Verona.
 I think Crab my dog be the
    sourest-natured dog that lives: my mother weeping, my father
    wailing, my sister crying, our maid howling, our cat wringing her
    hands, and all our house in a great perplexity; yet did not this
    cruel-hearted cur shed one tear.
 Now come I to my mother.


                            Enter PANTHINO

  PANTHINO.
 Launce, away, away, aboard! Thy master is shipp'd, and
    thou art to post after with oars.
 What's the unkindest tide?  
  LAUNCE.
 Lose the tide, and the voyage, and the master, and the
    service, and the tied! Why, man, if the river were dry, I am able
    to fill it with my tears; if the wind were down, I could drive
    the boat with my sighs.

  PANTHINO.
 Will thou go?
  LAUNCE.
 The DUKE'S palace

Enter SILVIA, VALENTINE, THURIO, and SPEED

  SILVIA.
 Servant, you are sad.
 Seem you that you are not?
  VALENTINE.
 Wise.

  THURIO.

  THURIO.

  THURIO.
 Give him leave, madam; he is a kind of chameleon.

  THURIO.

  VALENTINE.

  THURIO.

  SILVIA.

  THURIO.
  
  VALENTINE.

    What say you to a letter from your friends
    Of much good news?
  VALENTINE.
 Ay, my good lord, I know the gentleman
    To be of worth and worthy estimation,
    And not without desert so well reputed.
 I knew him as myself; for from our infancy
    We have convers'd and spent our hours together;
    And though myself have been an idle truant,
    Omitting the sweet benefit of time
    To clothe mine age with angel-like perfection,
    Yet hath Sir Proteus, for that's his name,
    Made use and fair advantage of his days:
    His years but young, but his experience old;
    His head unmellowed, but his judgment ripe;
    And, in a word, for far behind his worth
    Comes all the praises that I now bestow,
    He is complete in feature and in mind,
    With all good grace to grace a gentleman.

  VALENTINE.

  DUKE.
           Exit DUKE
  VALENTINE.

  SILVIA.

  SILVIA.
 Nay, then, he should be blind; and, being blind,
    How could he see his way to seek out you?
  VALENTINE.
 His worth is warrant for his welcome hither,
    If this be he you oft have wish'd to hear from.

  SILVIA.
 Not so, sweet lady; but too mean a servant
    To have a look of such a worthy mistress.
 Leave off discourse of disability;
    Sweet lady, entertain him for your servant.
 I'll die on him that says so but yourself.
 Once more, new servant, welcome.
 How does your lady, and how thrives your love?
  PROTEUS.
 Enough; I read your fortune in your eye.

    Was this the idol that you worship so?
  VALENTINE.
 No; but she is an earthly paragon.
 When I was sick you gave me bitter pills,
    And I must minister the like to you.
  
  VALENTINE.

    My foolish rival, that her father likes
    Only for his possessions are so huge,
    Is gone with her along; and I must after,
    For love, thou know'st, is full of jealousy.

  PROTEUS.
 But she loves you?
  VALENTINE.
 Go on before; I shall enquire you forth;
    I must unto the road to disembark
    Some necessaries that I needs must use;  
    And then I'll presently attend you.
 Will you make haste?
  PROTEUS.
 A street

Enter SPEED and LAUNCE severally

  SPEED.
 I
    reckon this always, that a man is never undone till he be hang'd,
    nor never welcome to a place till some certain shot be paid, and
    the hostess say 'Welcome!'
  SPEED.
 Marry, thus: when it stands well with him, it stands well
    with her.
 What thou say'st?
  LAUNCE.
 It stands under thee, indeed.

  SPEED.
 'Tis well that I get it so.

  SPEED.

  LAUNCE.
 I tell thee my master is become a hot lover.

  SPEED.
 At thy service.

    O sweet-suggesting Love, if thou hast sinn'd,
    Teach me, thy tempted subject, to excuse it!
    At first I did adore a twinkling star,
    But now I worship a celestial sun.

    This night he meaneth with a corded ladder
    To climb celestial Silvia's chamber window,
    Myself in counsel, his competitor.

Verona.
 Better forbear till Proteus make return.
 O, know'st thou not his looks are my soul's food?
    Pity the dearth that I have pined in
    By longing for that food so long a time.

    The current that with gentle murmur glides,
    Thou know'st, being stopp'd, impatiently doth rage;
    But when his fair course is not hindered,
    He makes sweet music with th' enamell'd stones,
    Giving a gentle kiss to every sedge
    He overtaketh in his pilgrimage;
    And so by many winding nooks he strays,
    With willing sport, to the wild ocean.

    I'll be as patient as a gentle stream,
    And make a pastime of each weary step,
    Till the last step have brought me to my love;
    And there I'll rest as, after much turmoil,  
    A blessed soul doth in Elysium.
 But in what habit will you go along?
  JULIA.
 What fashion, madam, shall I make your breeches?
  JULIA.

  JULIA.
 A round hose, madam, now's not worth a pin,
    Unless you have a codpiece to stick pins on.

  JULIA.
 If you think so, then stay at home and go not.
 Nay, that I will not.
 Then never dream on infamy, but go.

    If Proteus like your journey when you come,
    No matter who's displeas'd when you are gone.

  LUCETTA.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.
>>



ACT III.

    Thus, for my duty's sake, I rather chose  
    To cross my friend in his intended drift
    Than, by concealing it, heap on your head
    A pack of sorrows which would press you down,
    Being unprevented, to your timeless grave.

  DUKE.

  DUKE.

  DUKE.

    'Tis not unknown to thee that I have sought
    To match my friend Sir Thurio to my daughter.

  VALENTINE.

  DUKE.

  VALENTINE.
 What lets but one may enter at her window?
  DUKE.
 This very night; for Love is like a child,
    That longs for everything that he can come by.
 Then let me see thy cloak.
          [Reads]
      'My thoughts do harbour with my Silvia nightly,
        And slaves they are to me, that send them flying.
 Neither.

  PROTEUS.
 My ears are stopp'd and cannot hear good news,
    So much of bad already hath possess'd them.
 Then in dumb silence will I bury mine,
    For they are harsh, untuneable, and bad.
 No, Valentine.

    Hath she forsworn me?
  PROTEUS.
 Ay, ay; and she hath offered to the doom-
    Which, unrevers'd, stands in effectual force-
    A sea of melting pearl, which some call tears;
    Those at her father's churlish feet she tender'd;
    With them, upon her knees, her humble self,
    Wringing her hands, whose whiteness so became them
    As if but now they waxed pale for woe.

    Here if thou stay thou canst not see thy love;
    Besides, thy staying will abridge thy life.
  
    The time now serves not to expostulate.

    As thou lov'st Silvia, though not for thyself,
    Regard thy danger, and along with me.

  PROTEUS.
 Go, sirrah, find him out.

  SPEED.
 Why, as black as ink.
 I will try thee.
 Tell me this: Who begot thee?
  SPEED.

  SPEED.
 Ay, that she can.

  SPEED.
'
  LAUNCE.
'
  LAUNCE.
 What need a man care for a stock with a wench, when she can
    knit him a stock.
'
  LAUNCE.
 That's as much as to say 'bastard virtues'; that indeed
    know not their fathers, and therefore have no names.
 Close at the heels of her virtues.
'
  LAUNCE.
 'Item: She is proud.
 'Item: She hath no teeth.

  SPEED.
 'Item: She is too liberal.

  SPEED.
 What's next?
  SPEED.
'
  LAUNCE.
 Thou must run to him, for thou hast stay'd so long that
    going will scarce serve the turn.

Milan.
 The DUKE'S palace

Enter DUKE and THURIO

  DUKE.
 Sir Thurio, fear not but that she will love you
    Now Valentine is banish'd from her sight.
  
  PROTEUS.

  DUKE.

    Proteus, the good conceit I hold of thee-
    For thou hast shown some sign of good desert-
    Makes me the better to confer with thee.

  DUKE.

  DUKE.
 Ay, but she'll think that it is spoke in hate.

  DUKE.

    But you, Sir Thurio, are not sharp enough;
    You must lay lime to tangle her desires
    By wailful sonnets, whose composed rhymes
    Should be full-fraught with serviceable vows.
 Say that upon the altar of her beauty
    You sacrifice your tears, your sighs, your heart;  
    Write till your ink be dry, and with your tears
    Moist it again, and frame some feeling line
    That may discover such integrity;
    For Orpheus' lute was strung with poets' sinews,
    Whose golden touch could soften steel and stones,
    Make tigers tame, and huge leviathans
    Forsake unsounded deeps to dance on sands.
 And thy advice this night I'll put in practice;
    Therefore, sweet Proteus, my direction-giver,
    Let us into the city presently
    To sort some gentlemen well skill'd in music.

    I have a sonnet that will serve the turn
    To give the onset to thy good advice.
  
  DUKE.

  SECOND OUTLAW.
 Stand, sir, and throw us that you have about ye;
    If not, we'll make you sit, and rifle you.
 Then know that I have little wealth to lose;
    A man I am cross'd with adversity;
    My riches are these poor habiliments,
    Of which if you should here disfurnish me,  
    You take the sum and substance that I have.

  THIRD OUTLAW.
 Have you long sojourn'd there?
  VALENTINE.
 For what offence?
  VALENTINE.
 For that which now torments me to rehearse:
    I kill'd a man, whose death I much repent;
    But yet I slew him manfully in fight,
    Without false vantage or base treachery.

  VALENTINE.
 Nothing but my fortune.
 And I for such-like petty crimes as these.

  FIRST OUTLAW.

  SECOND OUTLAW.

  VALENTINE.
 How now, Sir Proteus, are you crept before us?
  PROTEUS.
 Who? Silvia?
  PROTEUS.
 Come, we'll have you merry; I'll bring you where you shall
    hear music, and see the gentleman that you ask'd for.


         Is she kind as she is fair?
           For beauty lives with kindness.

         Love doth to her eyes repair,
           To help him of his blindness;
         And, being help'd, inhabits there.

  JULIA.

  JULIA.
 I perceive you delight not in music.
 Not a whit, when it jars so.
 Hark, what fine change is in the music!
  JULIA.
 I tell you what Launce, his man, told me: he lov'd her out of
    all nick.

  JULIA.
 Gone to seek his dog, which to-morrow, by his master's
    command, he must carry for a present to his lady.
 Where meet we?
  PROTEUS.
 Farewell.
                  Exeunt THURIO and MUSICIANS

                  Enter SILVIA above, at her window

  PROTEUS.
  
    Who is that that spake?
  PROTEUS.
 Sir Proteus, as I take it.

  SILVIA.
 Sweet lady, let me rake it from the earth.
 Go to thy lady's grave, and call hers thence;
    Or, at the least, in hers sepulchre thine.
  [Aside]  He heard not that.

  JULIA.
 Who calls?
  EGLAMOUR.
 As many, worthy lady, to yourself!
    According to your ladyship's impose,
    I am thus early come to know what service
    It is your pleasure to command me in.

  SILVIA.
 O Eglamour, thou art a gentleman-
    Think not I flatter, for I swear I do not-  
    Valiant, wise, remorseful, well accomplish'd.
 Madam, I pity much your grievances;
    Which since I know they virtuously are plac'd,
    I give consent to go along with you,
    Recking as little what betideth me
    As much I wish all good befortune you.
 This evening coming.

Under SILVIA'S Window

Enter LAUNCE with his dog

  LAUNCE.
' I was sent to deliver him
    as a present to Mistress Silvia from my master; and I came no
    sooner into the dining-chamber, but he steps me to her trencher
    and steals her capon's leg.
 He thrusts me himself into the company of three or four
    gentleman-like dogs under the Duke's table; he had not been
    there, bless the mark, a pissing while but all the chamber smelt
    him.
' 'Ay, marry do I'
    quoth he.
.
 But she receiv'd my dog?
  LAUNCE.

    Away, I say.
 Stayest thou to vex me here?        Exit LAUNCE
    A slave that still an end turns me to shame!  
    Sebastian, I have entertained thee
    Partly that I have need of such a youth
    That can with some discretion do my business,
    For 'tis no trusting to yond foolish lout,
    But chiefly for thy face and thy behaviour,
    Which, if my augury deceive me not,
    Witness good bringing up, fortune, and truth;
    Therefore, know thou, for this I entertain thee.
 Not so; I think she lives.
 Alas!
  PROTEUS.

    'Tis pity love should be so contrary;
    And thinking on it makes me cry 'Alas!'
  PROTEUS.
 Well, give her that ring, and therewithal
    This letter.
 Tell my lady
    I claim the promise for her heavenly picture.

    Alas, poor fool, why do I pity him
    That with his very heart despiseth me?
    Because he loves her, he despiseth me;
    Because I love him, I must pity him.

    I am my master's true confirmed love,
    But cannot be true servant to my master
    Unless I prove false traitor to myself.

    Yet will I woo for him, but yet so coldly
    As, heaven it knows, I would not have him speed.

  SILVIA.

  SILVIA.

    Go, give your master this.

    This is the letter to your ladyship.
 The more shame for him that he sends it me;
    For I have heard him say a thousand times
    His Julia gave it him at his departure.
 Dost thou know her?
  JULIA.
 Almost as well as I do know myself.
 She is beholding to thee, gentle youth.

    Here, youth, there is my purse; I give thee this  
    For thy sweet mistress' sake, because thou lov'st her.
 And she shall thank you for't, if e'er you know her.
 I think,
    If I had such a tire, this face of mine
    Were full as lovely as is this of hers;
    And yet the painter flatter'd her a little,
    Unless I flatter with myself too much.

    Her hair is auburn, mine is perfect yellow;
    If that be all the difference in his love,
    I'll get me such a colour'd periwig.
 SCENE I.
 O, sir, I find her milder than she was;
    And yet she takes exceptions at your person.

  JULIA.

  JULIA.
 How likes she my discourse?
  PROTEUS.
 That you are well deriv'd.
 Saw you my daughter?
  PROTEUS.
 Why then,
    She's fled unto that peasant Valentine;
    And Eglamour is in her company.

    These likelihoods confirm her flight from hence;
    Therefore, I pray you, stand not to discourse,
    But mount you presently, and meet with me
    Upon the rising of the mountain foot
    That leads toward Mantua, whither they are fled.

    Dispatch, sweet gentlemen, and follow me.
               Exit
  THURIO.
 Why, this it is to be a peevish girl
    That flies her fortune when it follows her.

    I'll after, more to be reveng'd on Eglamour  
    Than for the love of reckless Silvia.
                   Exit
  PROTEUS.

  FIRST OUTLAW.
 Being nimble-footed, he hath outrun us,
    But Moyses and Valerius follow him.

  SILVIA.

    They love me well; yet I have much to do
    To keep them from uncivil outrages.
  [Aside]  How like a dream is this I see and hear!
    Love, lend me patience to forbear awhile.

  SILVIA.
 O miserable, unhappy that I am!
  PROTEUS.
 Unhappy were you, madam, ere I came;
    But by my coming I have made you happy.
 By thy approach thou mak'st me most unhappy.
  [Aside]  And me, when he approacheth to your presence.

    Thou hast no faith left now, unless thou'dst two,
    And that's far worse than none; better have none
    Than plural faith, which is too much by one.

  PROTEUS.
 O heaven!
  PROTEUS.

    Who should be trusted, when one's own right hand
    Is perjured to the bosom? Proteus,
    I am sorry I must never trust thee more,  
    But count the world a stranger for thy sake.

  JULIA.
 How! Julia!
  JULIA.

    How oft hast thou with perjury cleft the root!
    O Proteus, let this habit make thee blush!
    Be thou asham'd that I have took upon me
    Such an immodest raiment- if shame live
    In a disguise of love.
  
  PROTEUS.

  JULIA.

  DUKE.
  
  VALENTINE.
 Here she stands
    Take but possession of her with a touch-
    I dare thee but to breathe upon my love.

  DUKE.
 The more degenerate and base art thou
    To make such means for her as thou hast done
    And leave her on such slight conditions.

  VALENTINE.
 I warrant you, my lord- more grace than boy.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.

  CAMILLO.

  ARCHIDAMUS.
 Wherein our entertainment shall shame us we will be
    justified in our loves; for indeed-
  CAMILLO.

  CAMILLO.

    Since their more mature dignities and royal necessities made
    separation of their society, their encounters, though not
    personal, have been royally attorneyed with interchange of gifts,
    letters, loving embassies; that they have seem'd to be together,
    though absent; shook hands, as over a vast; and embrac'd as it
    were from the ends of opposed winds.
 I think there is not in the world either malice or
    matter to alter it.
 Nine changes of the wat'ry star hath been
    The shepherd's note since we have left our throne
    Without a burden.

  POLIXENES.
 No longer stay.

  POLIXENES.
 Very sooth, to-morrow.
 My affairs
    Do even drag me homeward; which to hinder
    Were in your love a whip to me; my stay
    To you a charge and trouble.
 Tongue-tied, our Queen? Speak you.

  HERMIONE.
 You, sir,  
    Charge him too coldly.
 Well said, Hermione.
- Yet, good deed, Leontes,
    I love thee not a jar o' th' clock behind
    What lady she her lord.

  HERMIONE.
' Verily,
    You shall not go; a lady's 'verily' is
    As potent as a lord's.

  POLIXENES.
 hostess.
 We were, fair Queen,
    Two lads that thought there was no more behind  
    But such a day to-morrow as to-day,
    And to be boy eternal.
 Was not my lord
    The verier wag o' th' two?
  POLIXENES.
 We were as twinn'd lambs that did frisk i' th' sun
    And bleat the one at th' other.
 What we chang'd
    Was innocence for innocence; we knew not
    The doctrine of ill-doing, nor dream'd
    That any did.
 One good deed dying tongueless
    Slaughters a thousand waiting upon that.

    Our praises are our wages; you may ride's
    With one soft kiss a thousand furlongs ere  
    With spur we heat an acre.

  LEONTES.
 Why, that was when
    Three crabbed months had sour'd themselves to death,
    Ere I could make thee open thy white hand
    And clap thyself my love; then didst thou utter
    'I am yours for ever.
'
  HERMIONE.

    I have tremor cordis on me; my heart dances,
    But not for joy, not joy.
 'T may, I grant;
    But to be paddling palms and pinching fingers,
    As now they are, and making practis'd smiles
    As in a looking-glass; and then to sigh, as 'twere
    The mort o' th' deer.
 Ay, my good lord.

  LEONTES.
 What! hast smutch'd thy nose?
    They say it is a copy out of mine.
 Come, Captain,
    We must be neat- not neat, but cleanly, Captain.

  LEONTES.
 Thou want'st a rough pash and the shoots that I have,  
    To be full like me; yet they say we are
    Almost as like as eggs.
 Women say so,
    That will say anything.

    Thou dost make possible things not so held,
    Communicat'st with dreams- how can this be?-
    With what's unreal thou coactive art,
    And fellow'st nothing.

  POLIXENES.

    How sometimes nature will betray its folly,
    Its tenderness, and make itself a pastime
    To harder bosoms! Looking on the lines
    Of my boy's face, methoughts I did recoil
    Twenty-three years; and saw myself unbreech'd,
    In my green velvet coat; my dagger muzzl'd,
    Lest it should bite its master and so prove,
    As ornaments oft do, too dangerous.

  LEONTES.
 If you would seek us,
    We are yours i' th' garden.
  [Aside]  I am angling now,
    Though you perceive me not how I give line.
 Should all despair
    That hath revolted wives, the tenth of mankind
    Would hang themselves.
 Many thousand on's
    Have the disease, and feel't not.
 Didst note it?  
  CAMILLO.

  LEONTES.
 Was this taken
    By any understanding pate but thine?
    For thy conceit is soaking, will draw in
    More than the common blocks.
 Not noted, is't,
    But of the finer natures, by some severals
    Of head-piece extraordinary? Lower messes
    Perchance are to this business purblind? Say.

  CAMILLO.

  LEONTES.

  CAMILLO.
 No, no, my lord.
 But I cannot
    Believe this crack to be in my dread mistress,
    So sovereignly being honourable.

  CAMILLO.
 I am his cupbearer;
    If from me he have wholesome beverage,
    Account me not your servant.


                     Enter POLIXENES

  POLIXENES.
 Methinks
    My favour here begins to warp.

  CAMILLO.
 Do you know, and dare not
    Be intelligent to me? 'Tis thereabouts;
    For, to yourself, what you do know, you must,
    And cannot say you dare not.

  POLIXENES.
 I may not answer.
 Therefore mark my counsel,
    Which must be ev'n as swiftly followed as
    I mean to utter it, or both yourself and me
    Cry lost, and so goodnight.

  CAMILLO.

  POLIXENES.
 For what?
  CAMILLO.
 O, then my best blood turn
    To an infected jelly, and my name
    Be yok'd with his that did betray the Best!
    Turn then my freshest reputation to
    A savour that may strike the dullest nostril  
    Where I arrive, and my approach be shunn'd,
    Nay, hated too, worse than the great'st infection
    That e'er was heard or read!
  CAMILLO.
 For myself, I'll put  
    My fortunes to your service, which are here
    By this discovery lost.

  POLIXENES.
 Give me thy hand;
    Be pilot to me, and thy places shall
    Still neighbour mine.
 It is in mine authority to command
    The keys of all the posterns.
 Please your Highness
    To take the urgent hour.
 The palace of LEONTES

Enter HERMIONE, MAMILLIUS, and LADIES

  HERMIONE.
 Come, my gracious lord,
    Shall I be your playfellow?
  MAMILLIUS.
 No, I'll none of you.

  SECOND LADY.
 Who taught't this?
  MAMILLIUS.
 Pray now,
    What colour are your eyebrows?  
  FIRST LADY.
 Blue, my lord.
 Nay, that's a mock.
 I have seen a lady's nose
    That has been blue, but not her eyebrows.
 Hark ye:
    The Queen your mother rounds apace.
 Pray you sit by us,
    And tell's a tale.

    Come on, sit down; come on, and do your best
    To fright me with your sprites; you're pow'rfull at it.
 Come on then,
    And give't me in mine ear.
 he met there? his train? Camillo with him?
  FIRST LORD.

    Camillo was his help in this, his pander.
 By his great authority;
    Which often hath no less prevail'd than so
    On your command.

  HERMIONE.

  LEONTES.

  HERMIONE.
 O thou thing!
    Which I'll not call a creature of thy place,
    Lest barbarism, making me the precedent,
    Should a like language use to all degrees
    And mannerly distinguishment leave out
    Betwixt the prince and beggar.
 How will this grieve you,
    When you shall come to clearer knowledge, that
    You thus have publish'd me! Gentle my lord,
    You scarce can right me throughly then to say
    You did mistake.
 There's some ill planet reigns.

    I must be patient till the heavens look
    With an aspect more favourable.
 Beseech you all, my lords,
    With thoughts so qualified as your charities
    Shall best instruct you, measure me; and so
    The King's will be perform'd!
  LEONTES.
 Who is't that goes with me? Beseech your highness
    My women may be with me, for you see
    My plight requires it.
 If it prove
    She's otherwise, I'll keep my stables where
    I lodge my wife; I'll go in couples with her;
    Than when I feel and see her no farther trust her;
    For every inch of woman in the world,
    Ay, every dram of woman's flesh is false,
    If she be.
 They are co-heirs;
    And I had rather glib myself than they
    Should not produce fair issue.

  ANTIGONUS.

  ANTIGONUS.
 Pray you, then,
    Conduct me to the Queen.

  GAOLER.
 So please you, madam,
    To put apart these your attendants,
    Shall bring Emilia forth.
                       Exeunt ATTENDANTS
  GAOLER.
 And, madam,
    I must be present at your conference.
 We do not know
    How he may soften at the sight o' th' child:
    The silence often of pure innocence
    Persuades when speaking fails.

  GAOLER.
 If
    The cause were not in being- part o' th' cause,
    She, th' adultress; for the harlot king
    Is quite beyond mine arm, out of the blank
    And level of my brain, plot-proof; but she
    I can hook to me- say that she were gone,
    Given to the fire, a moiety of my rest
    Might come to me again.

  LEONTES.
  [Exit SERVANT]  Fie, fie! no thought of him!
    The very thought of my revenges that way
    Recoil upon me- in himself too mighty,
    And in his parties, his alliance.

  ANTIGONUS.
  
  SECOND SERVANT.

  PAULINA.
 What noise there, ho?
  PAULINA.
 What, canst not rule her?
  PAULINA.

  LEONTES.

  LEONTES.

    I am as ignorant in that as you
    In so entitling me; and no less honest
    Than you are mad; which is enough, I'll warrant,
    As this world goes, to pass for honest.
 Take up the bastard;
    Take't up, I say; give't to thy crone.

  LEONTES.

  PAULINA.

    And thou, good goddess Nature, which hast made it
    So like to him that got it, if thou hast
    The ordering of the mind too, 'mongst all colours
    No yellow in't, lest she suspect, as he does,
    Her children not her husband's!
  LEONTES.
 A gross hag!
    And, lozel, thou art worthy to be hang'd
    That wilt not stay her tongue.

    So, so.

  LORDS.

  LEONTES.
  [To ANTIGONUS]  You, Sir, come you hither.

  LEONTES.
 It shall be possible.

  ANTIGONUS.
 Take it up.
 No, I'll not rear
    Another's issue.


                         Enter a SERVANT

  SERVANT.
 So please you, sir, their speed
    Hath been beyond account.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.

Sicilia.
 O, the sacrifice!
    How ceremonious, solemn, and unearthly,
    It was i' th' off'ring!
  CLEOMENES.

  DION.
 If th' event o' th' journey
    Prove as successful to the Queen- O, be't so!-
    As it hath been to us rare, pleasant, speedy,
    The time is worth the use on't.
 Since what I am to say must be but that
    Which contradicts my accusation, and
    The testimony on my part no other
    But what comes from myself, it shall scarce boot me
    To say 'Not guilty.
' Mine integrity
    Being counted falsehood shall, as I express it,
    Be so receiv'd.
 Now for conspiracy:
    I know not how it tastes, though it be dish'd  
    For me to try how; all I know of it
    Is that Camillo was an honest man;
    And why he left your court, the gods themselves,
    Wotting no more than I, are ignorant.

  HERMIONE.

    You had a bastard by Polixenes,
    And I but dream'd it.
 As you were past all shame-
    Those of your fact are so- so past all truth;
    Which to deny concerns more than avails; for as
    Thy brat hath been cast out, like to itself,
    No father owning it- which is indeed
    More criminal in thee than it- so thou
    Shalt feel our justice; in whose easiest passage
    Look for no less than death.
  
  HERMIONE.

    The bug which you would fright me with I seek.

    To me can life be no commodity.
 What is the business?
  SERVANT.

  LEONTES.
 This news is mortal to the Queen.
 Take her hence.

    I'll reconcile me to Polixenes,
    New woo my queen, recall the good Camillo-
    Whom I proclaim a man of truth, of mercy.

    For, being transported by my jealousies
    To bloody thoughts and to revenge, I chose
    Camillo for the minister to poison
    My friend Polixenes; which had been done
    But that the good mind of Camillo tardied
    My swift command, though I with death and with
    Reward did threaten and encourage him,
    Not doing it and being done.
 How he glisters
    Thorough my rust! And how his piety
    Does my deeds make the blacker!
  
                      Re-enter PAULINA

  PAULINA.
 What fit is this, good lady?
  PAULINA.
 What studied torments, tyrant, hast for me?
    What wheels, racks, fires? what flaying, boiling
    In leads or oils? What old or newer torture
    Must I receive, whose every word deserves
    To taste of thy most worst? Thy tyranny
    Together working with thy jealousies,
    Fancies too weak for boys, too green and idle
    For girls of nine- O, think what they have done,
    And then run mad indeed, stark mad; for all
    Thy by-gone fooleries were but spices of it.
 The higher pow'rs forbid!
  PAULINA.
 But, O thou tyrant!  
    Do not repent these things, for they are heavier
    Than all thy woes can stir; therefore betake thee
    To nothing but despair.

    Thou canst not speak too much; I have deserv'd
    All tongues to talk their bitt'rest.
 I am sorry for't.
 Do not receive affliction
    At my petition; I beseech you, rather  
    Let me be punish'd that have minded you
    Of what you should forget.
 Upon them shall
    The causes of their death appear, unto
    Our shame perpetual.
 So long as nature
    Will bear up with this exercise, so long
    I daily vow to use it.
 Their sacred wills be done! Go, get aboard;
    Look to thy bark.
                           Exit
  ANTIGONUS.
 If such thing be, thy mother
    Appear'd to me last night; for ne'er was dream
    So like a waking.
' so, with shrieks,
    She melted into air.
 Affrighted much,
    I did in time collect myself, and thought
    This was so and no slumber.
 Dreams are toys;
    Yet, for this once, yea, superstitiously,
    I will be squar'd by this.
 Thou'rt like to have
    A lullaby too rough; I never saw
    The heavens so dim by day.
 If any where I
    have them, 'tis by the sea-side, browsing of ivy.
 Whoa-ho-hoa!

                          Enter CLOWN

  CLOWN.
 Why, boy, how is it?
  CLOWN.
 Now, now; I have not wink'd since I saw these sights; the
    men are not yet cold under water, nor the bear half din'd on the
    gentleman; he's at it now.

  SHEPHERD.

  SHEPHERD.
  
    So, let's see- it was told me I should be rich by the fairies.
 What's within, boy?
  CLOWN.
 You're a made old man; if the sins of your youth are
    forgiven you, you're well to live.
 Home, home, the next way! We are lucky, boy; and
    to be so still requires nothing but secrecy.
 Go you the next way with your findings.
 They
    are never curst but when they are hungry.
 I, that please some, try all, both joy and terror
    Of good and bad, that makes and unfolds error,
    Now take upon me, in the name of Time,
    To use my wings.
                      Exit




SCENE II.
 Say to me, when saw'st thou the
    Prince Florizel, my son? Kings are no less unhappy, their issue
    not being gracious, than they are in losing them when they have
    approved their virtues.
 Sir, it is three days since I saw the Prince.
 What his
    happier affairs may be are to me unknown; but I have missingly
    noted he is of late much retired from court, and is less frequent
    to his princely exercises than formerly he hath appeared.

  CAMILLO.
 My best Camillo! We must disguise ourselves.


      The lark, that tirra-lirra chants,
        With heigh! with heigh! the thrush and the jay,
      Are summer songs for me and my aunts,
        While we lie tumbling in the hay.
 With
    die and drab I purchas'd this caparison; and my revenue is the
    silly-cheat.
 I must have saffron to colour
    the warden pies; mace; dates- none, that's out of my note;
    nutmegs, seven; race or two of ginger, but that I may beg; four
    pound of prunes, and as many of raisins o' th' sun.
 O, help me, help me! Pluck but off these rags; and then,
    death, death!
  CLOWN.

  AUTOLYCUS.
 Come, lend me thy
    hand.
 O, good sir, softly, good sir; I fear, sir, my shoulder
    blade is out.
 How now! Canst stand?
  AUTOLYCUS.

    You ha' done me a charitable office.

  AUTOLYCUS.
 No, good sweet sir; no, I beseech you, sir.
 Out upon him! prig, for my life, prig! He haunts wakes,  
    fairs, and bear-baitings.

  AUTOLYCUS.

  CLOWN.

  CLOWN.
 Shall I bring thee on the way?
  AUTOLYCUS.
 No, good-fac'd sir; no, sweet sir.
 Then fare thee well.
 But that our feasts
    In every mess have folly, and the feeders
    Digest it with a custom, I should blush
    To see you so attir'd; swoon, I think,
    To show myself a glass.
 Apprehend
    Nothing but jollity.
 The gods themselves,
    Humbling their deities to love, have taken
    The shapes of beasts upon them: Jupiter
    Became a bull and bellow'd; the green Neptune
    A ram and bleated; and the fire-rob'd god,
    Golden Apollo, a poor humble swain,
    As I seem now.
 To this I am most constant,
    Though destiny say no.
  
  PERDITA.

    Address yourself to entertain them sprightly,
    And let's be red with mirth.

  PERDITA.

    It is my father's will I should take on me
    The hostess-ship o' th' day.
 Reverend sirs,
    For you there's rosemary and rue; these keep
    Seeming and savour all the winter long.

  POLIXENES.
 Say there be;
    Yet nature is made better by no mean
    But nature makes that mean; so over that art
    Which you say adds to nature, is an art
    That nature makes.
 You see, sweet maid, we marry
    A gentler scion to the wildest stock,
    And make conceive a bark of baser kind
    By bud of nobler race.
 O, these I lack
    To make you garlands of, and my sweet friend
    To strew him o'er and o'er!
  FLORIZEL.
 No; like a bank for love to lie and play on;
    Not like a corse; or if- not to be buried,
    But quick, and in mine arms.
 Come, take your flow'rs.

  PERDITA.

  FLORIZEL.
                                     [Music]

          Here a dance Of SHEPHERDS and SHEPHERDESSES  

  POLIXENES.
 She dances featly.
 So she does any thing; though I report it
    That should be silent.
 If young Doricles
    Do light upon her, she shall bring him that
    Which he not dreams of.


                      Enter a SERVANT
  
  SERVANT.
 He sings several tunes faster than you'll
    tell money; he utters them as he had eaten ballads, and all men's
    ears grew to his tunes.
 He could never come better; he shall come in.
 Forewarn him that he use no scurrilous words in's tunes.

                                                    Exit SERVANT
  CLOWN.
 Ay, good brother, or go about to think.

           Come, buy of me, come; come buy, come buy;
           Buy, lads, or else your lasses cry.
 He hath paid you all he promis'd you.
 Is there no manners left among maids? Will they wear their
    plackets where they should bear their faces? Is there not
    milking-time, when you are going to bed, or kiln-hole, to whistle
    off these secrets, but you must be tittle-tattling before all our  
    guests? 'Tis well they are whisp'ring.
 Come, you promis'd me a tawdry-lace, and a pair
    of sweet gloves.

  CLOWN.
 Why should I
    carry lies abroad?
  MOPSA.
 Is it true too, think you?
  AUTOLYCUS.

  AUTOLYCUS.
 This is a merry ballad, but a very pretty one.
 Let's have some merry ones.
 I can bear my part; you must know 'tis my occupation.

    Have at it with you.
 Get you hence, for I must go
             Where it fits not you to know.
       O, whither?
  DORCAS.
        Whither?
  MOPSA.
    Me too! Let me go thither
  MOPSA.
     Or thou goest to th' grange or mill.
  
  DORCAS.
    What, neither?
  AUTOLYCUS.

             Then whither goest? Say, whither?

  CLOWN.
 We'll have this song out anon by ourselves; my father and
    the gentlemen are in sad talk, and we'll not trouble them.
 Away! We'll none on't; here has been too much homely
    foolery already.
 Pray, let's see these
    four threes of herdsmen.
  
  SHEPHERD.
 Why, they stay at door, sir.

    The gifts she looks from me are pack'd and lock'd
    Up in my heart, which I have given already,
    But not deliver'd.
 Do, and be witness to't.

  POLIXENES.
 And he, and more  
    Than he, and men- the earth, the heavens, and all:
    That, were I crown'd the most imperial monarch,
    Thereof most worthy, were I the fairest youth
    That ever made eye swerve, had force and knowledge
    More than was ever man's, I would not prize them
    Without her love; for her employ them all;
    Commend them and condemn them to her service
    Or to their own perdition.
 I cannot speak
    So well, nothing so well; no, nor mean better.

  SHEPHERD.

  SHEPHERD.
 I have, but what of him?
  POLIXENES.

  POLIXENES.

  FLORIZEL.
 He shall not.
 Let him, my son; he shall not need to grieve  
    At knowing of thy choice.
 Come, come, he must not.
 And you, enchantment,
    Worthy enough a herdsman- yea, him too
    That makes himself, but for our honour therein,
    Unworthy thee- if ever henceforth thou
    These rural latches to his entrance open,
    Or hoop his body more with thy embraces,
    I will devise a death as cruel for thee
    As thou art tender to't.
  [To FLORIZEL]  Will't please you, sir, be gone?
    I told you what would come of this.

  CAMILLO.
 Why look you so upon me?
    I am but sorry, not afeard; delay'd,
    But nothing alt'red.

  CAMILLO.
 I not purpose it.

    From my succession wipe me, father; I
    Am heir to my affection.

  FLORIZEL.

  FLORIZEL.
 Hark, Perdita.
                     [Takes her aside]
    [To CAMILLO]  I'll hear you by and by.

  FLORIZEL.
 Not any yet;
    But as th' unthought-on accident is guilty
    To what we wildly do, so we profess
    Ourselves to be the slaves of chance and flies
    Of every wind that blows.

  FLORIZEL.
 Sir,
    The manner of your bearing towards him, with
    What you as from your father shall deliver,
    Things known betwixt us three, I'll write you down;
    The which shall point you forth at every sitting
    What you must say, that he shall not perceive
    But that you have your father's bosom there
    And speak his very heart.

    There is some sap in this.

  CAMILLO.
 One of these is true:
    I think affliction may subdue the cheek,
    But not take in the mind.

  CAMILLO.
 My good Camillo,
    She is as forward of her breeding as
    She is i' th' rear o' our birth.

  CAMILLO.
 Nay, but my letters, by this means being there
    So soon as you arrive, shall clear that doubt.

  PERDITA.

  CAMILLO.
 Nay, prithee dispatch.
 The gentleman is half flay'd
    already.

  AUTOLYCUS.
 Are you in camest, sir?  [Aside]  I smell the trick
    on't.


             FLORIZEL and AUTOLYCUS exchange garments

    Fortunate mistress- let my prophecy
    Come home to ye!- you must retire yourself
    Into some covert; take your sweetheart's hat
    And pluck it o'er your brows, muffle your face,
    Dismantle you, and, as you can, disliken
    The truth of your own seeming, that you may-
    For I do fear eyes over- to shipboard  
    Get undescried.
 Farewell, my friend.

  FLORIZEL.
 Fortune speed us!  
    Thus we set on, Camillo, to th' sea-side.

  CAMILLO.
 To have an open
    ear, a quick eye, and a nimble hand, is necessary for a
    cut-purse; a good nose is requisite also, to smell out work for
    th' other senses.
 What an exchange had this been without boot! What a boot
    is here with this exchange! Sure, the gods do this year connive
    at us, and we may do anything extempore.
 Every lane's
    end, every shop, church, session, hanging, yields a careful man  
    work.
 Nay, but hear me.
  [Aside]  Very wisely, puppies!  
  SHEPHERD.

  AUTOLYCUS.
 Whether it like me or no, I am a courtier.

  SHEPHERD.
 I know not, an't like you.
 This cannot be but a great courtier.
 His garments are rich, but he wears them not handsomely.
  
  CLOWN.

  AUTOLYCUS.
 Sir, there lies such secrets in this fardel and box which
    none must know but the King; and which he shall know within this
    hour, if I may come to th' speech of him.
 Not he alone shall suffer what wit can make heavy and  
    vengeance bitter; but those that are germane to him, though
    remov'd fifty times, shall all come under the hangman- which,
    though it be great pity, yet it is necessary.

  CLOWN.

  SHEPHERD.

  AUTOLYCUS.
 In some sort, sir; but though my case be a pitiful one, I
    hope I shall not be flay'd out of it.
 I will trust you.
                              Exeunt SHEPHERD and CLOWN
  AUTOLYCUS.
 If he
    think it fit to shore them again, and that the complaint they
    have to the King concerns him nothing, let him call me rogue for
    being so far officious; for I am proof against that title, and
    what shame else belongs to't.
 To him will I present them.

Sicilia.
 I think so.

  CLEOMENES.

  DION.
 There is none worthy,
    Respecting her that's gone.
 'Tis your counsel
    My lord should to the heavens be contrary,
    Oppose against their wills.
  [To LEONTES]  Care not for issue;
    The crown will find an heir.

  LEONTES.
 Thou speak'st truth.
 She had; and would incense me
    To murder her I married.
 Stars, stars,
    And all eyes else dead coals! Fear thou no wife;
    I'll have no wife, Paulina.

  PAULINA.

  CLEOMENES.

  CLEOMENES.
 Good madam-
  PAULINA.
 One that gives out himself Prince Florizel,
    Son of Polixenes, with his princess- she
    The fairest I have yet beheld- desires access
    To your high presence.
 This is a creature,
    Would she begin a sect, might quench the zeal
    Of all professors else, make proselytes
    Of who she but bid follow.
  
  PAULINA.
 Women will love her that she is a woman
    More worth than any man; men, that she is
    The rarest of all women.

  LEONTES.

    Your mother was most true to wedlock, Prince;
    For she did print your royal father off,
    Conceiving you.
 And hath he too
    Expos'd this paragon to th' fearful usage,
    At least ungentle, of the dreadful Neptune,
    To greet a man not worth her pains, much less
    Th' adventure of her person?
  FLORIZEL.
 Where the warlike Smalus,
    That noble honour'd lord, is fear'd and lov'd?
  FLORIZEL.
 The blessed gods
    Purge all infection from our air whilst you
    Do climate here! You have a holy father,
    A graceful gentleman, against whose person,
    So sacred as it is, I have done sin,
    For which the heavens, taking angry note,
    Have left me issueless; and your father's blest,
    As he from heaven merits it, with you,  
    Worthy his goodness.
 What might I have been,
    Might I a son and daughter now have look'd on,
    Such goodly things as you!

                      Enter a LORD

  LORD.
 Please you, great sir,
    Bohemia greets you from himself by me;
    Desires you to attach his son, who has-
    His dignity and duty both cast off-
    Fled from his father, from his hopes, and with
    A shepherd's daughter.

  LEONTES.

  LEONTES.

  LEONTES.
 She is,
    When once she is my wife.
  
  LEONTES.
 Not a month
    Fore your queen died, she was more worth such gazes
    Than what you look on now.
 Come, good my lord.
 The mantle of Queen Hermione's; her
    jewel about the neck of it; the letters of Antigonus found with
    it, which they know to be his character; the majesty of the
    creature in resemblance of the mother; the affection of nobleness
    which nature shows above her breeding; and many other evidences-
    proclaim her with all certainty to be the King's daughter.

  THIRD GENTLEMAN.
 Then you have lost a sight which was to be seen,
    cannot be spoken of.

  THIRD GENTLEMAN.

  FIRST GENTLEMAN.
 Are they returned to the court?
  THIRD GENTLEMAN.
 Shall we
    thither, and with our company piece the rejoicing?
  FIRST GENTLEMAN.
 Our  
    absence makes us unthrifty to our knowledge.
 I brought the old man and his son
    aboard the Prince; told him I heard them talk of a fardel and I
    know not what; but he at that time over-fond of the shepherd's
    daughter- so he then took her to be- who began to be much
    sea-sick, and himself little better, extremity of weather
    continuing, this mystery remained undiscover'd.
 Come, boy; I am past moe children, but thy sons and
    daughters will be all gentlemen born.
 I know you are now, sir, a gentleman born.

  CLOWN.
 Ay; or else 'twere hard luck, being in so preposterous
    estate as we are.

  CLOWN.

  CLOWN.

  SHEPHERD.
 I will prove so, sir, to my power.

  CLOWN.

    Comes it not something near?
  LEONTES.
 Does not the stone rebuke me
    For being more stone than it? O royal piece,
    There's magic in thy majesty, which has
    My evils conjur'd to remembrance, and
    From thy admiring daughter took the spirits,
    Standing like stone with thee!
  PERDITA.

  PAULINA.

  CAMILLO.
 Let be, let be.

  PAULINA.
 No, not these twenty years.
 It is requir'd
    You do awake your faith.
 Do not shun her
    Until you see her die again; for then
    You kill her double.

  POLIXENES.

  PAULINA.

  HERMIONE.
 I'll not seek far-
    For him, I partly know his mind- to find thee
    An honourable husband.
 Come, Camillo,
    And take her by the hand whose worth and honesty  
    Is richly noted, and here justified
    By us, a pair of kings.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.
  PROHIBITED COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION INCLUDES BY ANY
SERVICE THAT CHARGES FOR DOWNLOAD TIME OR FOR MEMBERSHIP.


  Upon her head a platted hive of straw,
  Which fortified her visage from the sun,
  Whereon the thought might think sometime it saw
  The carcase of a beauty spent and done.


  A reverend man that grazed his cattle nigh,
  Sometime a blusterer that the ruffle knew
  Of court, of city, and had let go by
  The swiftest hours observed as they flew,
  Towards this afflicted fancy fastly drew;
  And, privileged by age, desires to know
  In brief the grounds and motives of her woe.


  'His browny locks did hang in crooked curls;
  And every light occasion of the wind
  Upon his lips their silken parcels hurls.

  To make the weeper laugh, the laugher weep,  
  He had the dialect and different skill,
  Catching all passions in his craft of will,

  'That he did in the general bosom reign
  Of young, of old, and sexes both enchanted,
  To dwell with him in thoughts, or to remain
  In personal duty, following where he haunted.


  'Yet did I not, as some my equals did,
  Demand of him, nor being desired yielded;
  Finding myself in honour so forbid,
  With safest distance I mine honour shielded.


  'Nor gives it satisfaction to our blood
  That we must curb it upon others' proof,
  To be forbod the sweets that seems so good
  For fear of harms that preach in our behoof.


  '"Among the many that mine eyes have seen,
  Not one whose flame my heart so much as warmed,
  Or my affection put to th' smallest teen,
  Or any of my leisures ever charmed.


  '"O pardon me in that my boast is true!  
  The accident which brought me to her eye
  Upon the moment did her force subdue,
  And now she would the caged cloister fly.


  '"How mighty then you are, O hear me tell!
  The broken bosoms that to me belong
  Have emptied all their fountains in my well,
  And mine I pour your ocean all among.


  'For lo, his passion, but an art of craft,
  Even there resolved my reason into tears;
  There my white stole of chastity I daffed,
  Shook off my sober guards and civil fears;
  Appear to him as he to me appears,  
  All melting; though our drops this diff'rence bore:
  His poisoned me, and mine did him restore.


  'In him a plenitude of subtle matter,
  Applied to cautels, all strange forms receives,
  Of burning blushes or of weeping water,
  Or swooning paleness; and he takes and leaves,
  In either's aptness, as it best deceives,
  To blush at speeches rank, to weep at woes,
  Or to turn white and swoon at tragic shows;

  'That not a heart which in his level came
  Could scape the hail of his all-hurting aim,
  Showing fair nature is both kind and tame;
  And, veiled in them, did win whom he would maim.
